review: Our waiter Howie and busboy Nick were great. Swiss burger was really good.  Salty caramel shake was really good too

This is a welcome addition to the Bergen Town Center being the only restaurant with a full bar, great signature cocktails along with a good draft/bottled beer selection Red Robin Gourmet Burgers are consistently good. The restaurant is well laid out but has some service issues to work out. What I like about this location is no children are allowed in the bar/lounge area, this makes for a nice place to kick back and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere.The service at the bar is excellent at times, food arrives fast (10 min. ticket times), fresh and hot with plates cleared quickly. If your lucky enough to have Kristen as your bartender she's a delight, well trained and efficient with a great knowledge of the menu. Tess is another story, she must have worked at the DMV before with her attitude and slow indifferent service. When patrons sit at your bar you get them a drink first and then go back to your service bar, minus 1 star from my previous rating of four. Families are welcome to eat in the dining room that is partitioned off from the bar so this is a huge plus for me, in the bar they play decent music at a comfortable level and have a few large TV's tuned to sporting events. Thanks to John the corporate trainer and Junior our server, awesome show great job!  The pricing is reasonable, food above average, most of the staff well trained and management professional, If your already a fan of Red Robin you will not be disappointed. if you have never tried this chain I suggest you do, this particular location stands out from the others in the area thanks to it's addition of a 21+ bar area and a more interesting ambiance than your typical Red Robin or other burger themed restaurants for that matter. Much better experience than Bobbys Burger Palace! BTW No difference between Red Robbin & Red Robin Gourmet Burger LOL!

Fantastic service. Our waitress Dominique was the best. Our order took longer then it should have, we didn't mind.. But the manager gave us our entire meal free! Def coming back soon. Good burgers good fries good shakes and amazing employees !

This was our first experience at a Red Robin in a very long time.  Also, I believe it was the first time either of us had been to a Red Robin Gourmet Burger. We began with 2 items for the $5 appetizers.   The onion rings were very good and came with ranch sauce and their Campfire sauce.  My wife enjoyed the Campfire sauce with the onion rings.   The second appetizer was the Bar Wings 'b' Yukon Chips - 1/2 order.  I selected the Buzzard sauce for the wings which was described by the waitress to be similar to a Buffalo sauce.  She was right.  The appetizer tasted great but was a questionable value even at $5.  There were only 4 wings!   Red Robin Gourmet has lots of sauces to choose from and are generous with regard to bringing you more etc! Wife's main was the Crispy Arctic Char or Cod.  I have seen both on their online menus and am unsure which one she ate.  She liked the sandwich.  She got the unlimited cole slaw so that we could share. My main was the Burnin' Love burger.  Red Robin Gourmet Burger for some strange reason can't do rare, medium rare, medium etc like the rest of the world.  Instead your options are "some pink" or "no pink".  Weak.  The burger was very messy.  The actual meat had little to no flavor and is a thinner patty than I prefer.  The sweet potato fries are bottomless.  It is a bit confusing on the menu.  They were very good and I enjoyed dipping them in the Thai chili sauce and the ranch sauce from the onion rings. Service was slightly overbearing but overall very efficient. We passed on dessert.

In all fairness this place only opened a week ago so hopefully they'll get better. But let me tell you about my experience. By the way I'd give them 2.5 stars if I could. It certainly wasn't terrible. When we arrived they sat a table of 5 in the bar. Not sure why they would think that a bunch of people in their 40's and 50's would like to be in a very noisy bar during a football game but I digress.  Our waitress informed us that she was 18 and new and never had a waitress job before. When I ordered my burger she informed me that "medium well" was the rarest they cook burgers there... really? So after she leaves i go to the front desk where 4 employees are standing around doing nothing. I ask them and none of them have any idea if that is true. "we aren't waitresses, sorry" they say.  I ask for the manager and he comes over and thanks me for alerting him, as although they do have a minimum temperature they cook to, he assures me their burgers come out pink on the inside. He has no idea why our waitress told us medium well. Turned out that is what her trainers told her to say. The manager was at a loss. Food came out... it was meh... tasted like a good burger I'd have made myself on the grill outside, nothing special. Some things were not cooked properly but not terrible. When we got our food we realized that there was no salt, pepper or ketchup on the table. When the "bottomless fries" came out on one of our plates there was about 12 french fries. When we asked for more... they never came. Then to apologize for never bringing them two different people brought us more even though we were already leaving. We sat waiting for things for entirely too long. This was not the waitresses fault, she was very sweet and attentive albeit not very experienced. But the runners just didn't do their job very well. There is more but I'll not bore you.  The menu is interesting and some nice ideas but I'm not going back to a burger joint that won't cook me a med rare burger, pink inside or not, especially with Zin Burger about 1 mile away, who's Kobe burger is hands down the best burger I've ever eaten.

They are definitely going through some opening issues. Arrived at 6:26 pm. We're told the wait would be 30 min. Well 55 minutes later our table was finally ready. Ordered our drinks and appetizers and the appetizers beat out the drinks. There was a delay with two of the drinks and they did take them off the bill. It was the manger who made that decision on her own. Without us saying anything about. Then we waited close to an hour for our dinner. They ask if you want a little pink or no pink in your burger. Well we all asked for a little pink but that did not happen. None of them had any pink. But we do not like to send back food so we ate them. Also the kids ordered dishes that had riblets in them. There needs to be a mention of how spicy they are as neither of the kids, age 9 and 12 could eat them. They told us after the meal you can request less spicy, but there was no mention of this in the menu. The restaurant also appears very small with a bit of a strange layout. It is going to take some time to work out the kinks. Having been in Red Robins in other areas, this one does not measure up yet. Hopefully it is just new opening headaches and will get better, but it really has a long way to go.  I must say though that the staff was going out of there in the dining room to try and help as they were aware of all of all the issues.

I can honestly say this is the best service I've ever gotten from a red robin.  I had never actually tried there burger till now..not a big fan tasted too char for me. Not for me but everything else was good and the service was great. I love the strawberry lemonade there!

Such a jubilant looking place! A lot of families with young children. The minute I walked in i wanted a milkshake. Its got that Johnny Rockets feel to it.  Came on a Sunday to satisfy a burger craving. We sat near bar area since they had the games playing. To eat, I had a bacon cheeseburger with avocado - it was pretty good, although avocado was barely there. Fries were just okay. Steak fries arent my favorite, especially when they're not cooked well. My boyfriend had a regular red robin burger with an egg added to it with sweet potato fries. The sweet potato fries were better than steak fries. As an appetizer we had onion rings which came with  2 dipping sauces - which came after we had our meal. -_-  Service: service was merely okay. The bartender was our waitress. Was polite. Took our order, checked in once, but that was it. Our appetizer was never brought it, when I mentioned it to her after we had our meal, it was still quite a while before it came out. She didn't check to see if we wanted refills on our drinks not anything, checked in once just very early on. Then it took a while to get her attention for bill.  Overall, I was satisfied with our meal. I would return BC I want a milkshake (lol) and bc I really really want to try their blue moon beer milkshakes! Lol

I'm only giving it three stars because I've been to other locations and I actually like it at other places, but the one that just opened up at the Bergen Town Centre is really not p to par with the rest. I am hoping that it gets better with time.. I usually try to avoid going to places as soon as they open up.  The service is probably the first thing I would say needs to be improved. EVERYONE is slow here, so I can only assume that maybe they are all inexperienced. The hostesses are friendly and enthusiastic, but the waiters definitely do not seem happy to be there. And again, they are slow.   The food didn't seem to be what I remember from the other locations I've been to (one near the Poconos, PA and the other being in Woodbridge). I ordered Keep it Simple burger with avocados, meat with a little pink in it and steak fries. The burger was very dry, with 3 baby slices of avocado in a condiment cup, 3 slices of pickle, and 3 baby rings of red onion. The steak fries, which usually come in a basket, were given in a small metal ring. I guess it doesnt matter that much since they are bottomless anyway, but who knows how long it would have taken if i had wanted more fries.  Most of my coworkers seemed to like their food though, and their onions rings were actually really good with the right amount of crispy batter. Their mini dogs (I forget the official name) were way too salty - i think the sausage in general was saltier than preferred.  Guess I can't expect a whole lot from a chain restaurant, but I really liked Red Robin until i came to this one. Will go back some time later to see if they've improved.

We went here with very high hopes. The service is so bad, and the best part is when the manager asked us how everything was, we told him our concerns, and he glazed right over us and could not get away from our table fast enough. The burgers are good, and so are the onion rings, shakes, root beer floats,  and  straw onions. I would never ever go back.
Why is the table next to us getting there food first before us even though we got here 10 minutes before, plus it took us 1 hour to get seated.  The service freakin sucks here!!!!!!!!!!!

Finally I get to sit down and write a lovely review for Red Robin...yyyuummm!!!...who has not heard the catchy jingle on television as burgers, salads, fries, and dipping sauces parade on the screen. I finally got up the nerve to come here since I had never had Red Robin before in my life. I have gone a total of three times and as they say three times is the charm. My first trip here I was served by the lovely Tess at the bar. She took my order after she was finished getting down drink orders for the rest of the bar and the restaurant. I ordered the cup of clam chowder and the Red Robin Royal which came out charred on the bottom, fries less than hot and crispy, but  hey at least my apple martini was good. My second trip, I decided to order a Whiskey BBQ burger add to that bacon, egg, and take away the tomato. The same problem as before but this time they left off the darn barbecue sauce. I decided not to complain because well I was enjoying a great meal with a few minor setbacks. Finally, on my most recent trip which was this past Friday they got it right. Ordered another Whiskey BBQ burger (didn't put on as much and only asked the tomato be removed), got a side of thai chili sauce for dipping my fries, and when it came to me it was ordered and served perfectly. The burger was nice and juicy with some pink in the middle and the fries were cooked to perfection.  So what are the pros of this place? Well if there is one thing I cannot get enough of is the fact that their restaurant and presentation of their food is flawless. I know I have had some problems with my order being made properly, but I hate when I expect to get a great juicy burger topped high with great toppings and instead could have opted for McDonald's and their cheap take on a burger. You do not get this with Red Robin, you get exactly what they advertise and what they sell. The exterior and interior are clean. Cannot stand a dirty place to eat and they always greet and say good bye with a smile on their face (even if they are dead tired).  And the prices are not half bad. For a cup of clam chowder, Red Robin Royal burger, and a good drink I don't recall paying over $30.00. And their happy hour is Monday through Friday from 3-6 pm and from 8 pm to close.  The cons: Well you can read my two previous visits and the mere fact that one time ordered an apple martini and instead of being green and having some kick to it. Heck I got totally opposite of that SMDH But if you at least give it try you will not be disappointed
The burgers are really good and the service is great.  The onion rings are great.  Our server Andrew was great!  Ask for Andrew when you go.

Just got home. We sat in the area straight ahead as you enter the restaurant. We were seated right away - lots of twos in this area. Server came over right away. Short stack of onion rings appetizer and splurged on shakes.  They don't do medium rare - a touch of pink hamburgers. Shakes great - I love getting the extra in the metal container -onion rings  were better than average. My burger came barely warm. Hubby's steak sandwich was hot. Asked for well done fries - didn't get them.  This part of the restaurant is freezing. Its only 48 degrees and we could not wait to get to the car and crank up the heat. People eating with their coats on or trying to change seats. I'll be back when the temperature is over 70!

Went tonight for dinner and had the most exceptional experience because of . Randy our server he was amazing!! And to me service is first priority. The food took forever to come out and was definately not worth the wait. Ill visit again in a couple months since it is very new.

Been here three times already since they have opened. Delicious burgers!!  I've had the royal burger with the egg which was delicious, the meat was boarder line burnt. That was the only food problem I've run into at this place, the three times going. Not bad at all. The crispy chicken sandwich was the best thing I've had there. Definitely a must try!! The chicken is perfectly crispy. I've also had a bit of the whiskey BBQ burger which was delicious as well! The onion rings are perfect!! Beer battered yum!!  The happy hour is great!! $2.50 well drinks!! The restaurant is spotless. Only thing is if it's busy and you're sitting in the bar area, it may take a while for the servers to come but they are still very attentive even though they are running around a lot. This red robin had a different set up than I seen before. The bar is like it's own separate restaurant which is great since you're separated from the families. Very nice vibe.

Had never been to Red Robin before. Stopped in after shopping at Shop-Rite in Paramus, NJ. Food was really good, service was great. Will go back soon for dinner so I can try one of there spiked milkshakes.

I walked in with my boyfriend and the hostesses were too busy talking to greet us. We stood awkwardly until they were done talking. Our waitress was friendly and took our orders promptly. The drinks were fantastic. We were seated next to the computer where they enter meals. Our waitress was sorting utensils there at this computer and proceeded to drop a fork on my back without noticing.  Then we received our food - the waitress mixed up multiple parts of our burger order. We ate the food anyway, which was decent for being different than what we wanted.  Overall food was good but service is lacking. They need to have less staff that works more often so they learn how to do their job (since majority of staff has never been a hostess or waitress before.) I will come back in a few months and hopefully the staff will be more experienced with their job.

It should really be 3.5 stars but I rounded up to 4 because we received good service  and it was a good experience for a chain restaurant.  If you are looking for a gourmet meal with detailed service, read no further. We got there around 8:30 on a Thursday night, plenty of free tables but it wasn't empty.  There is a decent bar area and plenty of TVs.  Our server asked us if we wanted a table with a good view of a TV and changed the channel to my husbands game of choice (really appreciated).  We saw them do this for other customers as well where possible. The server walked us through the drink menu and let us have a small taste of a beer we were thinking about ordering but not sure about.  All our food and drinks came out quickly.  We both ordered burgers, delicious but not mind blowing.  They did forget an "add on" to my burger but they brought it out after I asked.  I'm a little more forgiving of this error since the staff is still pretty new but clean it up soon Red Robin!  We also got the gingerbread shake which was really good (recommend)! Good dinner spot if you want to catch a game or just have a no frills dinner.

Been here a few times now. Good burgers, decent beer selection for a chain although more craft beer would be nice. Servers are nice and seem to be knowledgeable of the menu. Bar area has tv's and some high top tables. Haven't tried the deserts yet but they look good.

Okay. Just wanna say the food is good.  the service SUCKS!  i walk behind these 2 guys n they were ordering take out i guess the hostess thought i was with them? So about a min or so of waiting i asked to be seated (theres like 5 employees just hanging out in the front).  i sit down. Go thru the whole menu like 2x....wait.....go on my phone.....wait.....text.....wait......okay wtf! After about 10 mins or so i looked to my right and see the 5 employees hanging out like ummmmm....?????  okay so one goes over. Apologizes and says she can't find my server.  Well THAT sounds good. So she takes my order. then my server comes and says sorry.  Okay no problem. pretzel bites were way too greasy and the lil ass sauce of cheese was okay.  the Salt pepper burger was VERY good.  But no ketchup on the table so i asked my server for ketchup and she brought it right away. The problem is they are WAY TOO OVERSTAFF!!! Double the amount of employees to customers.  Maybe it was a slow night? 8:45pm on a friday night.  Hmmmm?? black friday.  well there were so many employees hanging out in 3 groups or more as if they had nothing to do.  i noticed other customers had issues.  the employees looked bored. Maybe they were too busy talking with each other? No wonder the service sucked.   im not kidding when i say i counted 8 employees just hanging out by the bar.  the place was pretty empty. Maybe they went somewhere else cause they had the same issues i had. Service sucked

The service really wasn't terrible. It wasn't very busy when we walked in we got seated immediately.  The problem was the food. We started off with an appetizer. We ordered the Yukon chips & dip. The "Yukon chips" were anything more than super market ridged potatoe chips, the dip was actually very delicious though. Probably the best thing I had there. My boyfriend ordered the prime rib sandwich which just tasted awful. The "Prime Rib" looked disgusting. I ordered chicken & shrimp. The shrimp was so absolutely disgusting that I had to send it back. It was repulsive. It tasted like freezer burnt shrimp that had been thawed out in the microwave and then went onto my plate.  I wouldn't eat here again.

I don't know if it is because today is Monday, but I liked this place a lot! It is my 1st time and picked this place because it was the closest to where I was. I just saw the reviews now, and don't understand why it is 2.5 stars. I really liked the service and the food. The burgers and sauces were very tasty.

The Bergen County burger craze continues, this time I thought that Red Robin was smart in their location, offering an alternative to Bobby Flay's Burger Palace within, albeit an outdoor walk to, the Bergen Town Center. I've been to the Clifton location on several occasions and always enjoyed my experience there, so I expected the same good vibes this time around. It had been open for a few weeks already, so already I was going to give them the benefit of the doubt when it came to service. Turned out that service wasn't the problem, the food was. I ordered a Royal Red Robin, with all of its fried egg goodness, and a half order of onion rings. The half order was a new thing for me and was the perfect portion size for my wife and I. My wife had a burger as well, but she couldn't recall which one... What we could recall, however, was the extreme heartburn and accompanying headache that ravaged us for the rest of the night. This was a shame, because I enjoyed eating the burger, it tasted delicious while consuming it, the egg in the Royal Red Robin was cooked perfectly, and the onion rings and it's sauce were crispy and satisfactory.  While the service and friendliness of the staff flourished on what was a busy night, it was surprisingly the food and the effects it had to both of us that failed here.  It affected us so much so, that we swore this place off for the time being. Lucky for Red Robin, my craving for burgers trumps any type of bad memories, so I wouldn't be surprised if I give Red Robin a second chance...hopefully an updated review will follow.

The bleu ribbon burger was really tasty, the fries not much. The last time I was in a Red Robin was in Clifton NJ years ago at the Ramada Inn on Rt. 3.  Service good, food good, nice choice of microbrews.  I'll return soon!

I must say this place has fantastic service, but a HORRIBLE kitchen. Every time I go here they mess up my family's orders. The location on rt 3 is awesome but this spot really needs to get their act together.

I came here one day for Happy Hour with some coworkers (hadn't gone in ages).  The prices at HH are pretty darn good for a chain! The bartenders were all friendly and polite. The wait staff we had when we originally sat down (not at the bar) was insanely friendly also. He was really nice also when we shifted over to the bar.  The bartenders even let us try out a few of the beers on tap so we didn't waste money buying one we didn't like. I got myself a tower of the onion rings, which were delicious! Also, the bartender who gave my friend her burger to go gave us additional fries since I mentioned if she had eaten the burger here, it's bottomless fries. They were more than happy to send her home with even more fries so she can have the bottomless fries at home.  A fan and would be willing to return. Especially for those onion rings.

This place gets 4 stars for the food. Service gets 0. So ill leave 2 stars overall.  We go on a Friday night which we obviously knew woukd be busy. Get seated in the bar section. Waited 10mins to be greeted by our server (who also was the restaurants bartender). Food took 30mins to come out.. had to ask our server where our food was. Then we asked for more fries which never came out until we approached the manager. He never came to us until he saw my bf approach the manager.  I get he was busy but c'mon man!!!!!!

This was our first time at this Red Robins location. There were several things wrong that happened that night that makes me never want to go again. First... Our waitress took our order and she didn't articulate how the sauces work. We were hoping to order some, but we wanted to avoid any charges. But she didn't specify which sauces would charge us and just looked at us "dumbly." Second... Our food took forever to come out. I think that's the longest I've ever waited for food. Third... The store itself is very cramped. My friends and I felt that we had to squeeze through tables and really try to avoid people just to get to the restroom. What a hassle... Fourth... The waitress put in my friend's order wrong. He wanted his burger without cheese but they put it in so he asked to take it back. It's an error anyone can make so that's not the actual problem. The REAL problem was it took them about another 30-40 minutes just to bring back a new order for my friend. As we saw other orders passing us by repeatedly. Fifth... One of the biggest attractions of Red Robins is the "unlimited fries." But they were rather slow with bringing it out. I think our table of 5 asked for more fries about 6 times and we only received fries 3 times (with about 15 minutes wait each time). Sixth... Our waitress brought over the wrong sauces...cmon!! Seventh... Our waitress sent over the manager in her stead at one point because she must have been nervous about messing up our order so many times. The manger did express concern, but I personally felt it was rude she couldn't come approach us herself or even apologize herself. Eighth... They charged us twice for the burger they messed up for my friend. I looked at the bill (and yes the manager compensated us $40) and in essence we were charged for a burger we never even touched. No restaurant I've ever been to ever does that. At the end after several complaints, the manger crumpled up our bill and said we could go. He did apologize too. At least that was on point..

Although I really like the burgers here, I found completely absurd that you have to wait 1 hour to get a table and on top of that the waiting room don't fit more than 10 people. This is specially excruciating when you are with kids! And this place is supposed to be a family restaurant. The place is well located next to the Bergen Town Center but too small for all the people that potentially come here after shopping at the mall.

GOT MY ORDER WRONG THREE TIMES. First they give me a chicken salad with gummy chicken, drenched in dressing. Then I ask for a veggie burger. Sorry but a rice and cheese patty isn't a veggie burger. Then I ask for a Bocca vegan burger to go instead...AND THEY GIVE ME A RICE AND CHEESE PATTY AGAIN. Never. Going. Back.

Terrible experience. It took over 30 minutes to get our dinner. When we finally did my order was wrong twice! When I finally got my food my burger wasn't even cooked and it was covered in grease!! Terrible experience and poor customer service. Completely disappointed!!

This was my second time eating at the Paramus Red Robin.  I have a wheat/gluten allergy and when I was there last time, my waitress was very accommodating. However, this time was another story. Our waitress switched tables after taking our drink order and a new waitress came along... Literally staring at us blankly as if we knew that our waitresses had switched. When I places my gluten free order she said let me get my manager to confirm any allergy orders. When the manager came over... He was utterly clueless  as to what was safe on their gluten free menu... Which in my opinion is not a good look if you are supposed to be ensuring that your food is gluten safe.  He said he was going to check that the avocado bacon burger wrapped in lettuce was OK to eat....and he never retuned to confirm my order. Then when my order FINALLY came out... It did not have all the Fresh vegetables that were supposed to be on top& it was on a gluten free bun that was so freezer burned that I just pushed it to the side.   They did not ensure the safety of my allergy because I was sick halfway through my meal, meaning that there was a lack of care with cross contamination in the kitchen. I seriously do not recommend this restaurant, especially if you have any sort of food allergy.

The food is fine, but the service and management is lackluster at best. I went with a group of 12 on a Sunday night. Things started out great, but then the following happened: 1) the waitress told us they didn't have freckled strawberry lemonade (which nullifies the restaurant's name, in my opinion) 2) a staff member who wasn't our waitress told us that they ran out of onion rings after we ordered them 3) the waitress forgot to bring out our appetizers altogether 4) the waitress forgot to bring out a friend's beer 5) the waitress didn't bring my table's settings; I had to ask a staff member who wasn't our waitress The waitress didn't apologize for anything until the very end as she was passing out the check. She and the other staff members just seemed annoyed all night, and the waitress barely stopped by to check on us. (BTW, the restaurant was empty, so it's not like they were busy or anything.) tl;dr: The food is fine, but the service is terrible.

Interesting new location.  I used to work at a Red Robin years ago in California and the food is just as consistent and tasty as always.  This location however is a little on the small side so tables are crammed in as tightly as possible so if you don't like sitting near people go to the location in Clifton off of rte 3.  Yuummmmmmm

I pretty much expected disappointment going to Red Robin because I saw the horrible reviews on here for it but my wife was feeling nostalgic for them since she used to eat at one all the time near her at her first job. When we got there we were seated quickly but understand why the whole row of large booths were available because every time the door opened the cold air would hit you.  The servers were very polite and checked up on us constantly which is remarkable considering it seemed only 4 or 5 of them were working the entire floor.  We made sure when we left to tip them well and I hope everyone else did so as well because they were running around non-stop. As for the food, my wife and I both ordered burgers and it took a ridiculous amount of time for us to get our food.  The server apologized to us and we noticed they were making the same apology over and over again to other patrons.  Again, it seems like they have a staffing issue. When we got our food we were both disappointed because the patties were pretty tasteless and even though we both ordered specialty burgers they were really unimpressive and really missed all marks on taste.   I ordered this burger: Burnin' Love, "The King would approve of this one. Topped with fried jalapeño coins, tangy salsa, Pepper-Jack, tomatoes and chipotle aioli on a jalapeño-cornmeal kaiser roll. It's love at first bite."  and had to put ketchup and their signature seasoning to make it tasty despite all of their toppings.  Our fries were also lukewarm, limp and probably could have used another few minutes in the fryer. Basically, skip Red Robin regardless if you're feeling nostalgic or are particularly hungry.  There are tons of burger options in the area and you could do much better.

I had an amazing experience here. Our server randy was so nice, polite and tended to our table as needed.  I got a bacon cheeseburger with chipotle and barbecue sauce on the side and it was all soo delicious. Sweet potato fries good burger good margarita good. Everything was good!  We will be back!

Good food. Good service.  Try the French dip.  Must try the onion rings.  Get the tower of rings. Server on top of everything.  Refills, yes, on the soft drinks.  Mice stocked bar for the drinkers.  Try it!!!"

Popped in here after a full afternoon of shopping across the street at Bergen Town Center Mall.  Very underwhelmed by the service and food.  Sat at the bar to avoid the 15 minute wait and while the bartender was very nice, I was served a plate with no cutlery or condiments.  I had to ask for silverware, napkins and repeatedly for condiments, which arrived towards the end of my meal.  Fries were cold and sparse but since they weren't that good, not an issue.  I used a Birthday Burger coupon so not sure that was reason for poor wait service and quality of food.  For mall visitors, I think both Whole Foods and Bobby Flay's Burger Palace are much better bets, for both price and food.

Foods are okay but service is TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!! Waited for my foods for 30mins and that's when I got my appetizer. Are you kidding me????? It was not that busy night. Waiter didn't even come to explain what's going on. Do I have to call you for you an explanation?? After 30min??
Two of my friends got sick from eating here. Along with bad service. Never going back!

We have made 6 visits since this location opened, around October, I guess. This is the only Red Robin I have been to so I can't compare it to other specimens of this chain, but  I can say that a lot of the criticism is quite accurate. We thought the slow kitchen to be a function of an inexperienced kitchen when it opened. Over the intervening months, it has not really improved. We usually wait about 45 minutes to get our order.  The French Fries are soggy unless you ask for Extra-well done fries. In cold weather, you do have to be careful where you sit because a lot of the tables near the doors get big drafts of cold air when the doors open  Why do I give it 3 stars? Because the burgers are quite good and good value.  The most recent DGB was quite tasty.  I also enjoy the patty melt and the all-American The bar is great with ample beer and cocktails for reasonable prices.  Compared to the low-end burger joints and BBP this place is civilized. Service is congenial It is a nice alternative for a reasonable, economical meal.

I've been to this Red Robin location about three times now. First two times, I've tried their burgers (tip: get the burger with the fried egg on top, I think it's called the Royal Robin. SO GOOD, the egg makes a delicious difference) and the last time I was here I opted to try their buffalo chicken tenders (surprisingly they were good. The buffalo sauce was not overpowering and they did not make the tenders soggy, I would probably order this again if I'm not craving a burger).  They have consistently good food here. The bottomless fries are a great deal. The fries are seasoned well and paired with one of their many sauces (the Thai chili is a personal favorite) you really can't go wrong. Another thing that they do well here are their drinks. Something that I was skeptical to try but ended up really liking was their blue moon milkshake. Yes, it's a beer/milkshake combo but it works. They really emphasize the orange flavor and it just tastes good. You get a hint of beer and even though it beer and dairy don't sound like the greatest combination believe me when I say that the blue moon shake here is really, really good.  The one thing that is hit or miss about this location is the service. The first time I went here the service was AMAZING. Our waiter was really attentive and he constantly was checking up on us and even gave us free sauces because we had mentioned we liked them so much. We didn't need to look around and search for him when we needed something. It was great. The second time, the service was okay. Not as great at the first time, but it also wasn't terrible. The most recent time I was here, the service wasn't great. We had to wait a while to get water refills and when we wanted either refills on fries or something, the waiter was nowhere to be found. Now, I've only eaten in the bar area, not in the family-oriented side, so I don't know if it's just where I'm sitting that makes the service not great. I understand if the restaurant is busy, it's harder to get to everyone and see what they need, but the last time I came here, it was not terribly busy. Maybe I'm being nit-picky, I don't know. They lose a star because service can either be good or bad. I will definitely be back at Red Robin. The prices are decent and the food is good. The mediocre service isn't all that fun, but in this case, the good outweighs the bad and let's be honest, they had me at "bottomless fries."
My first visit to Red Robin. I love the commercials BTW. Nice clean establishment . The food was good and the prices were even better.

Only ate at this location once and it was super early in the afternoon on a weekday when they first opened up a few months ago, there was an abundance of servers and literally maybe only one or two other tables with guests besides us. It took a while to get our drinks after we were asked if we ever ate red robin speech.  Shake was good, burgers were sub par compared to other red robin locations I've tried and waitress was slow and there was no reason for it being it was so dead. If there was a more local RR i would definitely go to it but the other semi local one is out of the way.  I may give them another shot one of these days, everyone has an off day I suppose.

I went to Paramus for my first Red Robin experience. It was noon on a Saturday with plenty of seating available. I ordered the Burnin' Love Burger with Steak Fries and Very Berry Raspberry Limeaid. The place has a fixation with excessive ice which I think just gives the server more work to do since these are free refills and I needed many since it was delicious. John P. delivered my burger with the jalapeno pepper on top of the bun. My thought was a long the lines of...uhm..ok. I cut up the pepper and added it to the sandwich. It was a good tasting burger. My side of steak fries was extremely small but those are bottomless too. Again, more work for the server. I paid Amanda W. and went on my merry way.

There's only one thing I really like about Red Robin, and that's their onion ring tower. Stacked 13 high at $9, it's kinda expensive, but it's worth it. Stay away from the pick 2 appetizer thing, size is really small, might as well get 2 onion ring towers. Burgers here are OK. They served them no pink or a little pink, because apparently, their general clientele has difficulty with the range from rare to well done. I didn't find anything particularly impressive with their burgers. It felt like a dressed up fast food burger, much like Smashburger. Fries are OK. The seasoning on the table is Old Bay, just a little saltier. Not my favorite, but I wouldn't be against going here.

Great place for a great burger. Visited this site a few weeks back and they really do a great job.  The burgers were a bit overcooked but the manager fixed them and made new ones for our table. I would recommend Red Robin for anyone looking for a great burger and fun atmosphere.

I went to the Red Robin based upon my experience eating at this restaurant in another state - first time eating here in NJ. My family and I entered after 9pm into the very small waiting area, it was packed but when we were seated about 10 minutes later there were many tables empty. I was confused as to why we waited. We were seated and then had to wait about 6-7 minutes before the manager stopped by to see if we were attended to we advised no and mentioned the waiter would be with us shortly.....about 3 minutes later the waiter showed up, extremely happy acting like we had not been waiting for almost 10 minutes. We ordered appetizers and it arrived, we then had to ask for silverware since none was on our table when we were seated. I then ordered a favored lemonade drink and my wife ordered a berry drink, since the menu did not really give a good description of the drinks we later found out that we had been drinking each others drinks (they place the drinks on the table in front of the wrong people). Since it was bottomless drinks we asked for refills of a different similar drink, the waiter brought the same drinks we did not like (thus the reason for asking for something different). I am very skeptical if I will ever eat at this restaurant/location again. I can understand some mistakes if the place was packed but it was only about 60% full. And after all of that the food was decent, nothing awesome or grand about it.

This is my second time eating at Red Robin and the food service is horrible. While all the waiters are friendly and welcoming, the service is extremely slow. My friends and I ordered chips and guac and a burger...the food took longer than 45 minutes to come out. Though our waiter was great, he didn't  check on our table to let us know the process of the food or how much longer it'll take for the food to come out.  When my chips and guac came out, the guacamole was brown and looked like it sat out for a while. I make better guacamole better than this. My friend who ordered the burger which came out good but only got a few fries to go with it. Although it's bottom less fries, you don't wanna keep asking them to bring it out.  I honestly would not suggest coming here for a burger. Bobby's burger Palace is so much better !

Food: pretty good. Price: fair. Service: meh* (*= This location only) Been to Red Robin a few times in the Midwest, loved those, and to this not long after it opened. That time, I chalked up the slow service to being a new place. Nope, slow is the standard. One other thing I noticed: three lightbulbs out that I could see from my seat: 1) a blue pendant, 2) one of the HID track lights, 3) one of the bulbs in the "M" lit up like a Broadway sign. This speaks to a bigger management problem; they aren't paying attention to details, and who knows what else is being overlooked. Pass.

What a  nice little spot to grab--what else--a burger and fries? Pleasant atmosphere, fair price and while the burger wasn't  the best I've ever had it was really good.  One of these days I'm going to ask for my fries ""well done" and get them that way. These were sort of pale. Good but not well done.  Accompanying lettuce was fresh and the waitress explained how we could split fries economically. I'd go back for sure Oh and with my club soda order she asked if I wanted lemon or lime what?  I thought lines were endangered because of the lousy  winter. Say hello to my little green friend!

The food is great! Unfortunately, the service isn't. It's my second time to this Red Robin and honestly, this may be a management issue. Cleaning the tables between servings takes too long. Seems the staff aren't well coordinated or aware of their responsibilities. That's one of the first problems I see with this location. After seating, the waiter that we were provided with took too long to attend to us, mind that it wasn't crowded in any way for the servers to be distracted. Waiter forgot several parts of our order multiple times throughout our stay and was constantly apologizing for it. He'd leave and never come back (even though it seemed ours was the only table he was servicing) to check on our order or ask if we needed anything else. Just watching the other servers or crew NOT attend to anything was plain disappointing. I'd recommend this staff and management work on their training to get this place more stars!

Tonight my family and I went to Red Robin  at the Bergen Town Center.  In one word atrocious.  I always leave a tip.  Tonight I did not.  Our experience began pleasant enough but quickly disintegrated into a nightmare.  First off it took for ever to receive our food.  My meal, the seafood scatter came out before a long wait.  Of course my soup appetizer never came out, until i mentioned this to a server.  The server who brought me my entree was someone else.  That's not what upset me.  I mentioned that our party still didn't receive our soups.  She abruptly walked away and stated something to the effect that she would check.  She didn't.  I observed her proceed to another table and begin clearing it.  Meanwhile my other family members hadn't even received their meals yet.  This server walked past my table several minutes later and I mentioned that she never came back with an answer or food.  She responded with a snippy attitude and response.  That pretty much set the tone for the remainder of our stay.  I received my soups after my meal was served.  Eventually the rest of my party received their food.  My wife complained that her Fish and chips dinner was unseasoned, bland, tasteless.  My stepson received french onion soup that was inedible.  It's as if someone took the salt shaker and dumped it in the pot.  My meal was Ok, but inconsistent. I piece of fish was also unseasoned and the other was heavily salted.  At some point, after I complained about the server the manager stated that she comped my chowder.  Throughout the meal, service was slow and inattentive.  We requested a refill on the bottomless steak fries.  It never arrived.  Our original waitress was apologetic but unable to resolve that issue.  She kept referring to everyone as "honey".  I normally keep my mouth shut, but I pretty much had enough and brought that to her attention.  Overall the experience was miserable and a huge waste of money and time. ***I completed an on-line customer service questionnaire.  For the sake of complete honesty, I just received a phone call from the store manager apologizing for my experience.  Based on his call, I will try this store again, but in the future.  I need to calm down and allow time for Red Robin to correct the obvious service and food preparation issues.

I'm hella late with this review, but here it is my experience here actually sucked especially for it being my first time. Starting off with my Corona seemed a bit flat for some odd reason, I ordered a black and Bleu burger medium rare w/ bacon and egg sunny side up, onion rings on the side. After a lengthy wait and I mean lengthy, onion rings were lukewarm, burger was damn near cooked well done. I asked for medium rare. Second corona came out just as flat as the first. The only reason why I gave 2 stars is because the manager was truly a sweetheart and the egg was cooked perfectly.

I like Red Robin's business style. the onion ring was fun to order, since it came out like a rings tower! and it was delicious~The burger here is very rich and huge portion, so beware before you take your order.  The sitting area is very open space, you get to experience lots movie posters. And they have TV in the restaurant, so you can watch sports or news during the meal.  the service was alright, not much greeting and when we were there, one girl came in and said "it's not my time yet so I can't take you in." It just give me a WTF. Very unprofessional. if you are not clock in, then pretend you're a customer walking to the bathroom or something, don't stand by the door and tell us you're not helping.

A family hamburger joint with bottomless soft drinks and fries.  A friendly attentive staff and gets our orders correctly.  Burgers are cooked right, fries are not the skinny fries, they are more like steak fries.  Join their rewards program as it is worth the frequent diners.  They are not the best burgers out there but by far they are not the worst.  Like I said, this is a family burger place perfect to visit to enjoy the meal with your loved ones.

The last time I went which was the first time I went, the food was phenomenal, service was great but going back today it changed my entire perspective.  It took an estimated 30-35 minutes for two burgers to get to our table and of course mine was burnt.  Would have asked for another one but I wasn't about to wait another 30 minutes for them to remake my burger.  The service was terrible, after our waiter "Sean" took our order, he came back to our table one time and asked "You like it?" to me then "You too?" to my boyfriend.  Didn't see him back at our table again.  He had three other tables and was sitting and talking to other co-workers as well as stayed on his phone.  No, it was not terribly busy but pay attention to your customers!!!  Last but not least there was a blonde waitress/hostess sitting at the table behind us and talking about other customers while we were there, very unprofessional.  Usually I am understanding with "not great" service considering my family is in restaurant business as well but I will not be returning to Red Robin, at least not the one in Paramus.

The service was absolutely horrible. Very slow with everything. After waiting a long time for the food to come out, I wasn't even satisfied with the food. The cheese in the macaroni and cheese was not fully melted and was not as good as I expected. The riblets were dry and not that great. When my food came out it wasn't even hot anymore and it was so slow i had already lost my appetite. At least they offered dessert on them because of their poor service.

Prior to my first visit here three months ago I had never even heard of Red Robin, so I asked a colleague what it was.  I was surprised (and excited) to hear that Red Robin was a burger restaurant!  I love new burger restaurants! So, off I went to order myself a Red Robin burger; after all they must *sarcasm* be good if they have the courage to open ANOTHER large, burger focused, restaurant in an already saturated niche... However, to my surprise I was not disappointed! We sat at the bar and ordered two burgers and two beers (they have an alcohol license which is also nice) on the burgers arrived they arrived properly cooked as requested.  They were seasoned very nicely and were nearly comparable to a Zin Burger! (see my other review, or my 'Burgers of Bergen County' list).  The fries were also excellent and I really have no complaints.  This is definitely a very strong four-star restaurant review, if I could give them a 4.5 I would.   Although there are many, many burger restaurants to choose from I can definitely see myself returning to re-visit Red Robbins, to sit at the bar and order another one of those delicious burger and fry combos sometime soon.

I used to go to the Red Robin location in Clifton with my fiance and we both enjoyed the food and the service.  This new location still has some catching up to do.  We came here on a weekday night when the restaurant wasn't crowded.  The first thing that we noticed was how SMALL the restaurant was compared to Clifton.  The restaurant looked cramped compared to the wide open space at the other location.   We then followed the hostess to our table and our waitress and waitress trainee quickly came to our table.  The service was a little bit off but this was mostly due to them being new to the position and experiencing a lot of growing pains.  She forgot one of the drink orders and for one of the burgers we requested no tomatoes, but that was forgotten also.  I'm sure the others in the waitstaff are fine. My major problem is the quality of the food.  The amount of fries you get with your burger is minute, no more than a hand full.  Granted, yes, it is bottomless but I could imagine how annoying it would be to keep having to refill. The burgers that we cooked we very raw after we asked for medium well.  Whenever I took a bite out of the burger, i kept having to wipe off the blood and oil from my mouth.  In conclusion, I would probably not come back unless they improve the quality of the food.

I never understand why people hate on restaurants like this. It's meant to be fatty and greasy. It's meant to be heart attack inducing if you ate it all the time. I mean - their selling point is "NEVER ENDING FRIES" -- did you think you were going to get a healthy meal here?  Anyway - I sat at the bar. Split a bacon cheeseburger with my husband which was cooked exactly how we asked for it; medium with crispy bacon. This came with a side of never ending fries which were f'ing delicious. They are topped with some sort of seasoning salt that makes you want to stuff your face with them. And then the dipping sauces too....really good. We had one that tasted like thousand island dressing and another that was similar to buffalo sauce.  The bartender was helpful and attentive. We had a whole meal with a beer for $25. I would definitely come back -- just not too soon as my heart needs some time to recover from all those fries.

Went last night and the service was horrible! Hostess was unfriendly.. I felt ignored bc it took a while after he went back and fourth to write my name down. Didn't even say welcome to Red Robin! At first waiter was nice took about 35 minutes for my food to come. Not once did he come to our table to apologize for the delay.  Food came by another server and I didn't have any utensils to eat it with. Waited for waiter who took long and then got the nerve to catch attitude bc I was upset that I didn't have any utensils!!!  Mind you I waited for about 10 minutes before I ate bc I was waiting to ask for the utensils!  But he sure gave me the check really fast!!

We have been to many Red Robins ( first one in this city of NJ ). Needless to say their burgers are dripping with grease. Had the lettuce wrap burger ( so no bread to soak up the grease) my burger was sliding all over the lettuce. And just dripping with grease. First let me backup to the entrance. Girl seated us waited and waited at least 10 min finally this disheveled waitress came, greasy bright red hair, long long moon nails... Just a turn off. Should have left. They were not busy very very small Red Robin. So I got the manager over and she stated that the hamburgers are not cooked in grease as my plate was full of it. She was a complete moron. No explanation for anything except would I like another burger. NO!!!! Or desert. NO!! Anyway waited and waited for the check had to get up to find someone to get her over with the check. I left no tip. I have never done this before and doubt they got the message. Anyway will never step my foot in this Red Robin again!! Stay away from the Red Robin at the Bergen Town Center!!!

I've been to another Red Robin and had food that I'd expect at a chain like this. The service has been good at others. I've been to the one at Bergen Town Center a few times and will not go back. The food is good - chicken is moist and flavorful and the burgers are good. The kids meals are a good value and the sweet potato fries are yummy. But the kitchen and management does not have its act together.  Each time we have waited 30 minutes or more for our food. One time the kids meals came in about 15 minutes and then we waited another 20 minutes for our food. Today we waited 35 minutes before anything came out and one of our orders took another 15 minutes because the server forgot to put it in (according to the manager, who threw the server under the bus right away). To her credit she took that dish off our bill.  Food is fresher than you'd expect but the consistently long waits have scratched this place off my list. Too many other options in the immediate vicinity!
Great place for a burger and a beer. I have only ever sat at the bar, so I can not comment on the table service.

I love red Robin and have been to several locations. I sat at the bar (I was the only one at the bar) on a non-busy weekday afternoon. The bartender did not greet me initially.  I even stared at him while he was fulfilling other drink orders that came through after I had been there. He finally came over with a menu and smiled like everything was all good. I knew what I wanted, so I immediately ordered.  I ordered a margarita, fish and chips and clam chowder. You would think if you're sitting at the bar... the only one sitting at the bar... that your drink would come quickly. It did not. He put in my order, then made other drinks.  This was a heavy set bartender who also had his son sitting at one of the booths on the side. His son came in after me and got his meal and milkshake before I even got my margarita. A margarita... ice, tequila, lime juice.. no blender, no extra ingredients, nothing complicated.  The thing that got to me was, the bartender kept smiling at me like everything was all good.  The food was good.. but being the only customer at the bar and having to wait like this while watching him make at least 8 other drinks is crazy. Another female waitress/bartender came in too and never acknowledged me or looked my way as I sat looking incredibly annoyed. I've been a waitress before, so I am extra patient and understand how things work in the business. But there was no reason for this. It was NOT busy and he wasn't training. I hate to pull the race card, but it was either a racial thing or they were just the dumbest restaurant staff on earth.

First time visit and what a disaster!  My husband and I were seated in the bar--we were not given a choice although the place was fairly empty. 3 TVs with 3 different games with sound on in a small area.  Yipes! We gave our order--when we requested water, we were asked "sparkling or bottled"? Once we asked for tap water, however, it was given.  Our order was taken quickly--four items--a cheeseburger with side of coleslaw, a blue cheeseburger with side of salad. When it was brought to the table, three out of the four items were wrong! I thought, perhaps, it was someone else's order. My husband got fries instead of salad, but he said he'd keep it. They took back my burger and the fries I didn't order and said they'd have to make new ones. It was twenty minutes before my correct order was brought to the table by the Manager. He was very apologetic and said he would not charge me for my meal.  Of course, by that time, my husband had finished his burger and fries. Definitely would not go back again. Something is way wrong with how orders are taken and filled. With so many options for medium priced chains like this in the area, why go back to one that has frustration on the menu?

I had never been to Red Robin, but it was on the way home so my mother and I stopped there. The waitress sat us down, and 10 minutes later two women to our right and two women to our left. We ordered before both pairs of these women and they were both served and almost finished before our meals even came. The waitress was extremely inattentive and barely even walked past our table the whole time we were there. I live in Clifton and will be trying out the Red Robin on Route 3, hoping that it's better.

My wife and a second couple went on a Fri. night. We were told it would be 1/2 hour wait which but we were pleasantly supprised to be seated ten min. later. However that is where it ended. We were seated at a table and a waiter carrying a tray of drinks spilled the drinks on the women. We were moved to a booth and a very nice waitress took our order. The drinks came out wrong and the women had to send their's back because they were rely horrible. The food took 35 min. to get to us and the burgers were cold and the fries were stale. I must say I was so very disappointed. I can say that I will never return there

We just left that restaurant, and we will never come back. We had to wait forever and the burger they served to my husband, no even the hungriest dog in my neighborhood could eat it. Very disappointed. The manager ( if there is one there ) should stop the party that was going on in the kitchen  and make them offer better services.

terrible  place. i am surprised this place exists in thousand oaks.if anyone's standards for service, quality and price are low than it might   thousand oaks ,  california where there are so many grest places to eat it just does not fit in.

I am being generous giving this place 2 stars.  The only reason I am doing that is because the food was acceptable.  When I arrived, the hostess really didnt acknowledge us.  I really wasn't even sure that she went to find us a table, until she came back a few minutes later.  I asked the manager for a copy of their gluten free options, and he said that it was online only and that it was store policy.  He was definitely a bit defensive about it.  Our server was a bit better at first, she made the manager bring over a tablet so that I could look at the gluten free options online.  But after that, her performance went from concerned and conscientious to perfunctory at best.  The food was hot and as far as taste goes, it was okay.  As a first time guest to New Jersey, it wasn't anything to write home about.  What could've turned this review around was the staff, but nope, they tanked it.

Okay... This has to be the worst Red Robin (and it's a new restaurant)as far as customer service...First the server ordered our drinks then she said oh you have a new server...everything was good until.... after our server dropped the food off.....I just heard crickets... Damnnnnn ..... I reported the terrible service to Gigi the manager but the crime was already done... We will never ever ever return to this Red Robin!

Ordered the Burnin Love burger (haha) from Red Robin as a take out order during lunch today.   It comes with salsa on the burger, but I asked them to exclude it and to add raw onions.  The burger overall was pretty good- bun was spicy (as described on the website) and the jalepenos were crispy.  Prices range, but my burger (with a side salad substitute instead of fries) cost about $13, including the tip I left for the server working the To-Go orders.   The server who answered for the To-Go order was friendly, prompt and professional.  When I arrived to pick up, she was pleasant and cashed me out quickly.

Went to Red Robin for a drink, an app and dinner. While there was nothing wrong with our visit, I cannot see a compelling reason to return. The pretzel bite appetizer was okay, my bloody mary was obviously a mix, my son's chicken fingers & fries were the same as they would have been at any chain restaurant and my buffalo chicken bites were a bit odd. They were 5 fried chicken morsels arranged over a bed of rippled potato chips with a few celery stalks, about a teaspoon of crumbled blue cheese and a cup of ranch dressing. Chips were soggy, chicken dry and ranch dressing tasteless.   While I don't expect anything spectacular out of this or any other chain, I think they could do better. The restaurant, while visually pleasing, is laid out in a weird fashion with many of the booths placed along a narrow corridor.  Also worth mentioning is that, while the place was less than 10% full, the mens room was in shambles with paper towels strewn about the floor. Granted, there is a sign instructing patrons to alert the staff if it requires cleaning but that should be their job, not mine.  Anyway, if you are looking to eat in a chain restaurant, and let's face it, there are times when we are and do not want to deal with crowds, there is nothing wrong with Red Robin. Unfortunately, there's nothing all that right with it either.

Ok, so I have seen Red Robin commercials.  It looked pretty good and we happen to find this one while shopping at the outlets.  My fiancé and I went there for lunch.  I ordered the Mushroom, Swiss burger and he ordered a BBQ Road house burger.  We were excited to try their burgers, and take advantage of their "unlimited" steak fries promotion.   We did get our food pretty quickly.  The burgers were meh.  Not memorable at all because it was really greasy.  I know burgers are supposed to be greasy, but this was ridiculous.  I couldn't pick up the burger, because the bottom of the burger was soaking wet and really mushy.  I have eaten a lot of "gourmet burgers" but this was just not for me.  I only ate  1/2 of my burger because it was just very odd tasting and I couldn't continue eating.  I ended up just eating their steak fries which were cooked perfectly and not greasy at all.     If you want additional fries order them immediately it's about a 15 minute wait to get them.  They give you very small portions, about 11-12 fries at a time.  I know it sounds crazy but I did count them.   After we got our food our waitress disappeared.  My fiancé wanted extra BBQ sauce for his burger.  We waited for about 15 minutes or so looking for our waitress waiting for her to return.  There were other servers there, but they pretended not to see us.  When our waitress finally re-appeared we asked for extra BBQ sauce, she said ok, but again she disappeared.  At this point we were ready for another soda re-fill.  After 10 minutes we asked a different server for just BBQ sauce they said ok, but they never came back.  This place was not even busy at all.     Our waitress finally re-appeared with a blank look, which was obvious she forgot the sauce.  So we just ordered soda re-fills.  It was obvious she was not on her game, but it's still annoying.  Normally, I can overlook bad service if the food was good, but in this case it was just not for me.
Good for family night out.  Service always top notch. Plus what doesn't love bottomless fries.
Could be much better if they didn't allow customers at the bar watching movies on their iPhones. The loud tinny noise was annoying!

There is truly nothing to hate about Red Robin, unless for some odd reason you have a bad experience. Which, let's be honest, with delicious burgers and unlimited fries it's not possible.  This location is across the parking lot from my job and it's always been on point for me. I've brought visiting family here for dinner, I came to recreate a first date with my boyfriend, and I've stopped in during lunch.  The burgers are always hot, juicy and cooked exactly the way I like. Great service, good bar options. Seriously, you can't go wrong with Red Robin..... YUM!

I came with a party of 5 and waited 20 min and still were not seated.  A party of three got seated before us even though half the restaurant was empty.  I complained and the waitress who was cleaning other tables tells me they are swamped and that is why we are waiting.  I see a lack of team work and customer service.  they only gave excuses and worked at a snails pace.  we left and are currently enjoying burgers across the street at bobby's burger palace.  this red robin needs a staff reset

Me and my friend were seated right away. It took the waitress 20 minutes to come over. Extremely slow and disorganized service. Music very, very loud, almost nightclub level. I was given the wrong, higher priced hamburger, but was too hungry to wait so ate it anyway. She didn't bother to give us cutlery or napkins, finally I had to ask the front desk. The food itself was ok, skimpy sized burger though Checks issued were wrong, had to wait another 20 minutes to have it fixed. The manager was extremely nice, I felt sorry for her having to work with completely inexperienced people. I was disappointed that there were any lighter item items showing the calories.

Stay away from this location ... the service is completely awful. Explains why it was almost empty on a Sunday afternoon. Have eaten at other locations and the food and service has always been great. The staff was more occupied by their phones than assisting customers.

Red Robin is so great to accommodate anyone with a food allergy. They have a wide selection, of delicious meals and sides. Service is attentive and friendly, and is an overall clean enviorment. The food here is great. YUMMM.

I have been to other Red Robins before and always left satisfied. I will NEVER come  back to this location. We were seated rather quickly, but it all went downhill from there. We were ready with our whole order by the time the waitress came. The appetizer we ordered were the pretzel bits, and two burgers  as our entree. We waited a good 30-45 for our food to come. And they totally skipped our appetizer. We got our burgers first and when i mentioned the appetizer, they said a manager would handle it (never saw so called manager). Our waitress only came before to place our order so she was MIA for most of the time. Our appetizer came right when we finished eating our burgers and it was horrible. I always ordered them at other locations but here i didn't even want to try them. My boyfriend lifted the plastic cup holding the cheese and half of it was melted(as if they put it in the microwave). Not wanting to make a scene i just wanted to ask our waitress if it was possible just to get a new side of the cheese saw. Her explanation: "they were kept under the lamp too long and the lamp melted the plastic". REALLY? The worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant  and i will never return to this location. Its basically slow in every department, and not worth the time or money.
The food was good. The service wasn't good. The waiters/waitresses rarely checked up on us but when they did, they were nice and friendly.

I hadn't been to a Red Robin in a while, and while the updated menu looked nice, I am not sure the changes were for the better. The burger was good, but no where near what I remember and is definitely more in line with other chains rather than a shake shack or five guys. The endless fries are a nice touch, especially with the seasoning, but the initial serving is tiny. Service was quite slow and my beer didn't arrive until I was already half done with the burger.

Long wait and no waiting area. Got a table and ordered food was ok. Opted for sweet potato fries for an additional 1.50, supposed to be bottomless, waitress never came back to ask if I wanted more. This place really needs to get there act together, really bad red robin.

They need a system on how to operate & better service to be a successful restaurant because they've got a good location . The food is good however so, if you do.get noticed & served, then you'd have a fun experience

Dined March 2015. Brand new restaurant and very clean including the restrooms. Dined at an off hour and service could have been better.However the burgers are definitely worth the visit and I will return again. They have a liquor license and plenty of parking. Overall if they could improve service (greet people faster and at least take drink orders quicker, food came relatively quick) they would be top in the area.

Do not come here. The food is awful. I ordered a chicken sandwich, which tasted like defrosted chicken. The onion rings were good, but I can only imagine how terribly unhealthy they were. Also the restaurant has a really bad greasy and oily smell to it, which made the entire dining experience unpleasant and I couldn't wait to leave. Poor service to top it all off. Will most certainly not be coming back.

This was my first time trying out a red robin (cue the music, yum) and I left with mixed reviews that warrants a 2nd chance at some point in the near future. They're stocked with a pretty great selection of cocktails and beers on draught. I had an alcoholic version of some kind of strawberry/lemonade drink & really enjoyed its size, flavor, & the edible macerated strawberries. As in any chain restaurant in this genre, don't expect fresh quality vegetables but the burgers themselves were decent as was my bbq chicken burger; I wouldn't say they're worth $10+ each, but they're decent. The onion rings are really good and worth getting for sure.  The all you eat fries concept is what led me to always wanting to try red robin (cue music, yum) but they were pretty disappointing. They give you small quantities as a time and it takes forever to come out (our server was great and gave us two baskets at once which really equaled one normal sized basket). The steak fries are filling so I'd opt for the thin sweet potato fries; if only they had unlimited onion rings...

Great place love they care about allergies. Our son has shell fish allergy and we where so excited he was not limited to anything on the menu.  Waitress was super nice! The service could be a bit faster and the personnel a bit more professional.  Witness a young man who was dancing up against another employee.  Them witnessed the hostess with her finger in her mouth picking her back teeth.  I definitely will go back.

Burger was OK. This place is more like beer drinking atmosphere than a burger joint. Little bit pricey But burger patties were alright.  Although they offer free french fries refill, how much potatoes a single person can eat?

CHECK YOUR BILL BEFORE PAYING!!!! Just ate here and what a horrible experience! Decided to go here with some friends because I knew it wouldn't be crowded. Took way too long to get first round of drinks. My friends wanted another serving of their "unlimited fries" which seriously took 45 minutes. Our waitress was full of excuses and pointing the finger at the kitchen.  My cousin ordered a glass of wine and waitress charged us for a bottle. We didn't notice her error until after the credit card was charged. She rung up another bill correctly charging for the glass of wine (when she should have just deducted her mistake). Wasted even more of our time when we just wanted to go home and get the hell out of there. Doubt she even processed the refund correctly.  I doubt the "error" on the bill was a mistake and probably just a scam trying to get more money and tip from us, trying to take advantage of us because we'd been drinking. If she rang up a bottle of wine then a bottle should've come out...I've worked in the industry before and know how the system works.  DON'T EAT HERE!!!!! Horrible customer service.  Slow, overweight staff.  Boring and unimpressive menu.  Low class atmosphere.  I would give it ZERO stars if yelp let me.

Awful!  Simply Awful... we walked in and they don't have anyone greeting you at the door.  My husband had to go find someone to seat us.  Then when our clown of a waiter Sean came by, he wasn't even paying attention to what our order was.. instead his eyes were glued to the TV and the game playing.  Do not go to this place.. you'd be better off in a Mc D's...

I love Red Robin. I really do. I have so many great memories of Red Robin which is why it hurts to give this place 2 stars but it really deserves 2 stars. I would give it 1 star but the Red Robin name alone prevents me from doing so. Also, I reserve my 1 star ratings for the absolute WORST of the worst.  So why do I hate this Red Robin? 1) Ambiance - I've been to a lot of Red Robins, but this one by far has the worst ambiance. It seems like there was zero thought put into the arrangement of the furniture or décor. The main area looks way too tight. Even the tables look cheap.  2) Food - Most of my vitriol is for the food. The food quality here simply sucks. Not only have some of my friends gotten sick from the food here, the food just doesn't taste fresh or good! I've been to this location three times (I know I'm an idiot for coming here that many times) and every time, my burgers (I've ordered three different burgers) were really soggy. I feel like even the order of the burger ingredients were off which only adds to the poor quality. Why would you put onion strings at the very bottom of the burger??? We also ordered wings this time, and they looked so old and dead. I expect wings to look fresh and have that orange glow, but these wings looked like they came straight from the fryer and sat out for a long time. I always ask for well-done fries, but even if I don't give special instruction, they should come out fresh and semi-crispy. Here, you tell them "well-done" and the fries still come out soggy and not fresh. Major disappointment.  3) Service - If you sit at the bar, you'll get pretty good service but in the other areas, the servers aren't very attentive even when the restaurant is empty.  I only came here a third time btw, cause I had to get my free birthday burger and this is by far the closest Red Robin around. I won't be coming back here again. Next time, I'll drive the extra distance and go to the Clifton Red Robin.

Went in for a burger with the gf. Worst service possible. We're Asian and the waitress went around and asked everyone else how their food was except us, as well as speak to us in a nasty tone from the get-go. She'd go around asking if other tables if they wanted refills on their freckled lemonade or fries and would BLATANTLY ignore us. Like I've never felt so disrespected while dining at a restaurant before. What the hell did I even do to you?!?!  We always smile and say yes please, and thank you... If you're the owner of this restaurant, I'd look into it. I was at the restaurant tuesday, April 28, at 845pm at the restaurant side on the right. Waitress is a caucasian woman. Can't recall her name. She got a terrible tip and she didn't even deserve that. Food was average at best. P.S. we give 20% minimum at all restaurants even when service is slow and subpar since we've both worked in the service business.  Except at this place for the first time ever. What a terrible experience.

Came here a few weeks ago for dinner with friends after hearing how much they love it here so we decided to give it a go. We arrived around 8:30 pm place was pretty much dead.. We waited at the front desk for what seemed like forever just to realize no one was coming to seat us so we grabbed a table in the back by the bar. Our waitress was very nice and did her best to take care of us and run the bar. We ordered drinks and a few appetizers for the table.  Appetizers were the pretzel bites with cheese dipping sauce and the onion ring tower with 2 different sauces. The onion rings were really good. Nice think cut onions with a really enjoyable crunch factor. The pretzel bites were good as well but nothing to write home about. Would still order them again though.  For my main course I decided on trying the Southern Charm burger. Black Angus patty glazed with brown sugar and topped with candied bacon, honey BBQ sauce (that I got on the side), cheddar cheese and caramelized onions (got frizzled instead) on a toasted ciabatta bun. My burger was good but nothing I would write home about. I really didn't enjoy the ciabatta bun but that was my fault for trying to deviate from the plan. My boyfriend seemed to enjoy his Nacho crunch tavern burger.It's A burger topped with onions, tomatoes, pepper-jack cheese, crunchy tortilla strips and a cheddar cheese sauce made with lime, chile and cool, creamy ranch. I didn't even get to try a bite because he ate it all. One thing that I really enjoyed was my sweet potato fries, those were amazing.  Ill have to come back and try something else on the basic side next time, maybe I'll enjoy it more.
Love the happy Hour menu just the perfect amount of choices and plenty of drink selections to choose from. Bar has space for a group of friends with tv's to watch your sports.

Usually come here for happy hour with coworkers. The bar area is rather small however, it is never really crowded and the atmosphere isnt normally that lively. It's a good place to have a couple drinks and chit chat. The server is very nice and attentive.

Please steer far away from this place as the manager Adolfo along with his waitress Charlise are not knowledgeable in even seating the patrons in the correct table. I went with a party of 7 (child's birthday) to be seated in a six top. When I asked for another seat the waitress's response was that she could not deal with me and walked over to a manager. I could not understand on something so simple can result to this. The managers response was that he will talk to her. Was he to have a heart to heart conversation with her? Super unprofessional. Not correcting nor calming the situation. Thank you for saddening a child's crave. This goes out to true management and higher up's. Please revamp your business as its clearly failing.

We've been here a few times and have enjoyed each visit. There was one visit where the service was really bad....yes, it was crowded, but our server was very forgetful and we had to wait a long time for our food. The bartender actually ended up going to the kitchen to find out what was going on with our food. The manager came over with a mountain high ice cream dessert on the house, so we left pretty happy.
