It's rare these days to see management go the extra step to make customers happy!

Stupid. The waitress was mean and rude. Made us feel we had to hurry up and eat so she could leave. My burger was small and unseasoned. My boyfriends burger was straight up burnt. Like charred burnt. They got my mother in laws order wrong, then when we asked them to change it the waitress was noticeably upset. Never going here again. Hope this helps. Also the other customers were very very rude. Like unbelievably rude. My 10 month old son (being a small baby he is) was cooing and making noise and the woman a couple tables down was pointing and getting annoyed with him. Giving us crap stares every time he made noise. Just ridiculous.

This was terrible is all regards. First we were seated next to a table with a small child despite the fact the while dinning area was empty, would have appreciated some space between guests since it was available.  Next we ordered salsa and guacamole as an appetizer. The guac and salsa were the smallest portions I have ever seen and extremely salty.   We each ordered a burger and both were luke-warm, boarder line cold on the inside. I got broccoli as a side, requested butter and was told they didn't have any but could provide ranch instead. Since when is ranch a substitute for butter?  The other burger came with sweet potatoes fries which were also cold. After sending both meals back they were replaced with mildly warmer burgers but still not great.  At the end of the meal a nervous man who I assume was the manager on staff came over and repeatedly apologized, however didn't comp anything on the bill.   I would absolutely not return here.

I reviewed this place before, once to say it's one of the best burgers in Bergen county and another time to complain about the crab burger which I would never order again but today's rant is about the service, went last night at 5:30 with my wife, we were seated quickly but in the last booth in the back by the back door, we reviewed the menu, figured what we wanted and closed our menus, sat and talked, and waited and waited, after 10 minutes no server, I looked at my wife and I can tell she was getting annoyed, at 5:45 we got up and left, no one came over to even ask if we wanted water.  Warning, if you go there and get seated in the last three booths by the back door, move or leave because those are the seats from hell and you will starve.  The best part, I went there to get my free birthday burger, happy birthday to me, no burger.
The food is good. The ambience is great. The service is not on par. This is my second time going here. The bottomless steak fries take forever for the second round to come.

Gotta say the got the best god damn burgers out there out of all the other places near by that I've been 2. Everything about it was just so god damn good. From the appetizers, to the entrees, and then 2 the deserts. Left with a big full ass belly with good food that I had from there and with good service and reasonable pricing and deals, what is there 2 complain about ? I remember going here at that time several months back and it was a few days before going away on my school trip 2 Italy. Again it's Just 2 god damn good, pound 2 that bro !!!!!

We love red robin for a quick burger and the great onion rings. So Good !!!  Whiskey River BBQ is amazing as a wrap, burger even salad !  Root beer floats are a kid favorite here !!  We get the best serves from our favorite waitress Sam !! She really takes her job a step above most.  One downer is no Buffalo wings! Not a fan of the wings and chips thing. Chips are usually hard.  Weekends are a bit rough here, small location. But it works.

First couple of times we went it was great then it started to go down hill in service and quality of the cooking. Slow service, undercooked burgers, cold fries and they were not busy. We next tried the Palisades Mall location and found the same thing. The place was empty at 5:30 and they sat us next to the entrance in a booth that smelled like sweat. I asked to move to another table which we did. A short time later they sat someone else there without ever cleaning the booth? Waitress was in a rush but the food was not. Warm fries, not much chili on the burger, asked for extra salad dressing never got it. Don't think we'll be going back again too many other new burger places to try.

I have a love / hate relationship With this place.  Sometimes the burgers are delicious, other times I'm left like ehhh pretty flavorless.    The fries are good as advertised.   The appetizers are the bread & butter.  Red Robin has some of the best appetizers in the game.    Also the bar at this place is a nice quiet smallish bar that's great to grab a drink and bite to eat and watch a late night game.

My burger was delicious but the server was clearly overwhelmed. He had a section of 7 tables and did his best to help us but I can tell he was in over his head running around. Also, they have iPad looking things at every table which you apparently have to pay an ENTERTAINMENT FEE for. Nothing prompted us and no one told us about this fee. How ridiculous. I would've just downloaded a trivia game on my phone if I knew. Never coming back or recommending this place.

The service tonight was horrendous. We sat at a table in the bar. We waited about 15 minutes for our drinks... We were 10 feet from the bar. Our friends got the wrong milkshakes. Our server couldn't care less about being around to help us. Food took 30 minutes to come out. It was mediocre at best. Will not be returning and will be telling others.

We started coming here when it first opened.  We were driving by and saw it.  When we first started coming, we loved it.   It has the usual chain elements of cute pictures and art work. There are flat panel TVs ala sports bar motiff.  We have found the servers to be very eager to please and remember you if you are a regular.  We love Kate, Roxy and Deanna.  The managers are there to make sure you are happy.  Very good selection of burgers and Brews.  We love the Chophouse burger. It has a great bun to meat to condiment ratio.  You can get your burger to order if you don't quite like whats on a particular burger.  We like the fries and salads, which are unlimited. Nice!   Seafood Scatter is very good too.  OK this is all the good points.  We have some complaints too.  As mentioned in other reviews, many families bring young children and they can be loud or disruptive to people who want a quiet meal.  The managers are very agreeable and will move you if you aren't happy. Same if you don't like the way something is prepared. (We have found inconsistencies in preparation )  If you are polite and don't act like an idiot, most restaurants are happy to give you what you want.  I don't understand why people don't speak up if they aren't happy with something.  They just gripe in the review.   What we have mentioned but can't get changed: We have noticed that the company has changed many things that we really liked.  We used to LOVE the salads. They were made just right, had croutons and I can't explain why, just tasted great.  They changed that to little square bowls and no croutons and they just aren't as good.  While the Mac and Cheese is still good, they started putting it in the little square bowls as well. The servings are much smaller.  When we mentioned this, we got a "Change is good" response.  Obviously, these are corporate decisions and the managers just have to go along with it.  While you do get unlimited refills on the salads and such, they just aren't as good.  Fries are still good. There is a questionnaire with the check. I hope the RR Corp reads these.  We don't come as often.
never again. a scam to your customers to slip in 1.99 charge to play trivia. sneaky sneaky. we caught you trying to hide it in the bill.

We were shopping at REI next door so decided to try this place since none of us had been here before. From the get go you could tell the people working there did not want to be there. The host led us to the table without as much as 3 words and a grumpy face. Waitress took our orders. The French onion soup was horrid. Returned the soup. Burgers came next nothing great for $14 a burger. Bottomless fries means nothing because the waitress came by once and forgot to bring more fries. Children's Mac and cheese was rubbery and over cooked. Oh and for desert got the brownie with ice cream that was hard as a rock and returned that as well. Will never step foot in another red robin ever again.

I wish there was an option for minus stars, im going to get to the point, service horrible, saw the waitress three times, one to order food second time when she brough the food, third time to give us the bill (bottomless fries? Really since no waitress ever, we had to ask another waitress which said she couldn't order for our waitress but will let her know. So yeah no more fries.  Onion soup disgusting, order Mac and cheese for my 2 year old grandchild, it tasted it like rubber maybe cause it was burned, definitely not for any kid, I do will say that the burgers were Excellent, never the less the dessert multi hot brownie with ice cream was hard as a rock we gave it to another waitress to take it to the manager, she took it off our bill, so there goes the one star. Good luck

There is nothing gourmet about this place.  Unlimited fries. So what. Waited ten minutes for the waiter. Ordered a Diet Coke with extra lemon. You would think I was asking to much. It took 4 times asking  the waiter for lemon.  But it also took another 5 minutes to get my soda.  I ordered their gourmet cheeseburger.  Wait wait and still waiting....  Finally!!!  Ha! My burger is cold.    Could not find the waiter.  Wait wait  Finally waiter my burger is cold.  He said are you sure.   Errrr I'll get you a new burger. Oh yippee!  Ha  Waiter is no where to be seen.  I asked the hostess to get the manager.  Before he got to my table .. My burger arrived.  Yippee. NO  IT WAS COLD. AGAIN  The manager arrived and I told him my disappointment.  He treated me like I was a liar. And I confronted him on that.  I told him I will pay for my drink and oh yes the onion rings. I forgot about them. The were good.  As far as anything else FORGET ABOUT IT.  Never never ever going back.
There was a fry in my freckled fruit salad...waiter laughed. Only go if you are really starving and haven't ate for weeks.

Oh. My. God. This was my first time trying Red Robin after being exposed to its catchy commercials throughout my lifetime (Yummm!) and I have to say I had a fantastic first experience.  Our server was delightful and made some amazing recommendations for our meal, including a Blue Moon milkshake which I never thought would exist, let alone drink. Once I did, I recognized what milkshakes had been missing all along ;) a little touch of inebriation with whipped cream. It was so delicious that I could count it as dessert. I had the deliciously on the sweet side Southern Charm burger paired with garlic herb fries and pickles -- and wait, it gets better. They have bacon sauce. You read that right. BACON SAUCE. I am definitely coming back! This is a true haven for fatasses at heart - and I wouldn't have it any other way.

Wow after reading the horror stories here not sure IF I want to go back. But went it for lunch today was in and out within an hour, got seated and served within 5 min....my server was "Kitty", friendly girl payed attention food didn't take long at all and my burger was awesome! And super delicious, kids attacked their fries and chicken.
Great food and great service! Amazing onion rings and jalapeno coins. Just wish that we could order a combo of the two like before. But still happy overall!

To start off, my boyfriend and I came here at 3:40pm, which is pretty much not a peak/busy time for restaurants. They were pretty good with accommodating the seat that we wanted but that's about where the good things ended. After we placed an order, it took over 30mins to receive our 2 burger entrees. Apparently, the table next to us accidentally got our order once they finally realized it 15 mins after they started eating it. And, that table actually asked them if they received the correct order, but without even checking, the server just say "yes", but it wasn't. So we had to wait another 15mins for our order to actually arrive. It was nice that they gave us some discount for that inconvenience but we were almost ready to leave if it wasn't for the desperate hunger we were feeling already. I'm pretty sure burgers doesn't take that long to cook. It took us less than half of the wait for us to finish our food. I couldn't wait to leave. This place is very disorganized and I don't recommend it. It's not the best burgers either. For a burger that is suppose to have mushrooms, 3 slices of mushrooms doesn't satisfy that description.

Disclaimer: I'm not a burger lover. I measure all burgers by M shack Portobello Mushroom Burger standards because THAT burger I love.  The other 4 people in my family are and they liked it. The bottomless fries are nice but our service was slower than molasses in winter. We arrived at 11 and we were only one of two tables. It got busier at noon but still.... My son's Swiss burger had a heap of mushrooms on it that cascaded onto his plate. Nice touch! I forget the name of my burger, it was fine as I recall but nothing to sing about. As I mentioned before, everyone else liked it so 3 stars it is.
The fries weren't crunchy also the burger had a lot of grease, it didn't taste like a burger and also i have tried better burgers in other places

This is my favorite red robins I have been to! Food is always top notch and staff is great as well, especially Kate! She is the best person on staff! Unlimited fries and root beer floats are always an option! So many substitutes for sides and most have no charge for them! Great place for desserts too. Awesome milk shakes, great ice cream, and now have a donut tower with dipping sauces similar to their onion ring tower. Lots of stuff on the menu, salads, burgers, wings, chicken, they have everything but the kitchen sink! All prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you get on your plate. I highly recommend this location! Two thumbs up

Really bad. This was the first time coming to a Red Robin and I was very disappointed. My chicken tortilla soup had no chicken in it and was cold. My sons French onion soup was cold. My Pepper and Smoke burger had one thin piece of bacon on it.  To top it all off my sons order was wrong and as I was calling the food runner back to the table to let him know he just kept walking ignoring me. His co workers all looked at me and heard me but said nothing. I had to get up and walk the order back to the kitchen myself to get it fixed. The waitress never bothered to come back and check on is at all. We were never even offered refills on our beers. I will never go back to this place again. Stay away!
Got a to go order Of prime rib dip that I got to go - burnt & salty. Need to get something done about the meal that I could only eat 1/4 of.

Hosts and hostesses seated us promptly and politely. We had fun playing games on the tablet provided, competing against other guests in a game similar to KAHOOTS. Ordered iced teas- tall cold- clean glasses. Burgers- I had the Red Robin burger (the one that made them famous). Everything was fresh. The bun is huge, lettuce piled 6 inches high! Crispy and fresh. Tomato and cheese of choice- burger cooked well - bottomless fries. Pretty good food, but for a burger place, the pattie was too thin and lost in the bread and lettuce/tomato. Fries were tasty- overall mediocre.
So good. Get the whisky burger, and the Fruffles... yeah,  YOU'RE WELCOME! I ate at the bar, and got excellent service from Miss Roxie. Her recommendations were spot on!

The burgers are good but nothing to lose your mind over. I received my burger medium how I asked and the food came out fairly quick. The place looks bigger on the outside then the inside. Red Robins is a decent burger place that serves alcohol.

2nd time here. Every other red robin I went to was awesome. This place has horrible service. You will wait forever. Forget about unlimited fries. You will see your waiter once and that is it. Not sure why this happens; must be idiots running the place. Do yourself a favor and go to Bobby's burger palace across the way !

So many better choices in the area, why waste your time. Burgers are ok, no big flavors. Service is okie, due to lack of servers on the floor. Our server had so many tables, that it took forever to get napkins or more ketchup. Managers were running food and wasn't really watching the floor. Don't waste your time and money, when you could have gone to Wendy's.

We usually go to the Red Robin in Clifton, but we were in the Paramus area so decided to stop in. We went in at about 5:15pm and the place was not crowded at all. It took 10 minutes for a waiter to even acknowledge us and take our drink orders. We got our appetizers (hot pretzel bites and the onion tower) in a timely manner, but they weren't even warm. We received our entrees about 20 minutes after ordering them. One of our entrees was so salty it was inedible. The waiter said that the guest could order something else at no charge so we did....of course they charged us. Was not a pleasant experience at all. Food was subpar and it seemed like the staff had no clue. We'll stick the Clifton location.
I had to wait literally 30 min to just get my food. I'm usually press on time because I only have an hour break. Thank you for wasting my time. Never coming back to this red Robin location.

Even looking at this red robin with the "what did you expect" mindset this place is terrible. Actually the scale I'm using for this particular location is McDonalds customer service and even then it fails. Food isn't bad, it's just the people that make the place miserable.  Don't bother coming to Red Robin unless you're looking for an example of how inept a group of people can be. You ever wonder what it would be like if the DMV decided to open up a restaurant? Here you have it. If the DMV did run the place, Patricia the hostess would make a great general manager. She has DMV written all over.  On the plus side, the following song makes sitting waiting an hour at your table for a burger a lot more fun: As the snow flies On a cold and gray Red Robin mornin' A poor little baby child is born In the ghetto And his mama cries 'cause if there's one thing that she don't need it's another hungry mouth to feed In the ghetto Update: Customer Service for Red Robin reached out to discuss this. After providing them the information to contact me they never followed up. Great job Jen K. At first I just thought this location was terrible. But it appears if may be the whole organization.

Visited this location again last night, and everything was fantastic. The waitress we had was awesome, the service was quick, and the food was delicious. I don't know if management changed, or this location just got better with time, but I'll definitely be visiting again!

No idea why the bad rating.  I really enjoy Red Robin's.  Bottomless fries, great mozzarella sticks (and do they still have those Zucchini Sticks?), Ensenada Chicken platter, Blue Moon shake, Stella on tap, had that pretzels thing going with the beer mustard or something like that, and I seem to recall some sort of Octoberfest burger.  Some of their seasonal menu items make you wish they were regulars.  I have to say, this place is comfort food for me.  Even just a beer and some fries here will do it.  By the way, tip: try their ranch dressing with their fries. ;) Another tip: for a burger joint, it's my experience that their burgers are not necessarily their strength, so try some entrees.

Amy is super sweet and very caring. I had the veggie burger, which was delicious. I highly recommend stopping in as this is in a great location and easy to get back onto route 4 to head back to NYC or trek to route 17.

The burgers are... mediocre at best. They taste like they were frozen prior to cooking. The service is great.  However, be prepared to wait at least 45 minutes if you go on a weekend.  Great place for kids.
Great food, fast service and affordable prices. Good chain, and Paramus location is a great example. Shakes were delicious, burgers served fast, and cooked as we wished them to be

I wish I could have gotten the bartenders name because she was amazing. Since we used the tablet on the table I forgot and I didn't get a receipt that says it.  I ordered a merry moscato punch and my boyfriend got Sam Adams Boston lager. The bartender was extremely friendly, knowledgable, and easy to have a conversation with.  For burgers I ordered a royal robin burger which has an egg on top with bacon and all the works and he got what I believe is called a pig out burger?  I've had the Royal burger before and it's always been good. Don't be fooled by the pig out burgers name it's pretty tiny and lacking a little if you ask me. It was basically a small bacon burger with bacon on it, but it could have just been because my burger was on the larger side. Regardless we split each burger so we could each try some so it worked out to our benefit.  Overall a great experience and I wouldn't hesitate to come back.  Make sure to have a seat by the bar!

The D.G.B burger is so yummy! Arugula, sun dried tomatoes and a garlic sauce!! Service can be slow here I believe it's because they are so under staffed. Coco was our waiter today! He was on point, friendly and quick with refills! A+ for us! Outstanding place to grab a bite to eat with anyone. We love the burgers {can't go wrong with a bacon cheeseburger} and pair it with an order of fish & chips {who doesn't love bottomless fries?} and share everything around the table. Attentive staff - and you always know the quality you're getting regardless of the location!

We loved Red Robin. We do not love Red Robin Paramus. Terrible Service, Cold Food, and my child became very ill within 2 hours of eating here.  We called Paramus with feedback and were given an attitude.  We called Corporate and were told there is nothing they can do. We will not be going back to Red Robin, in any location.  I agree with the fellow reviewers, who also strongly caution you to stay away.

It's a Red Robin. The food is going to be standardized. What differentiates chain locations from each other is service, and you could tell the manager was very aware of this location's reputation. He was constantly circulating, nudging the waitstaff to check on their tables. Kind of disconcerting since if we saw the manager so much on the floor, why didn't he just come around to the various tables? Our waiter was fantastic as he double dutied behind the bar. Wouldn't hesitate coming here again.

I love Red Robins but not Red Robin Paramus sucky service receptionist attitude unpleasant, I had better burgers elsewhere. They need to do better with a smile. The vegetables was not as fresh. .....................Up date...........................  So I decided to return several times to see if my experience would have change and it did The manager walked the floor to ensure that  customer were OK and satisfied , the burgers and vegetables weres fresh and well prepared, the waitress / customer service personnel were very attentive and courteous, Love the change and keep up the good work.

My friend told me they had good food so i decided to give it a try. I didn't know it was mainly known for burgers and thats a big reason why i give it only 2 stars because i believe there are so many more spots for a good delicious burger. I had ordered the guacamole bacon burger. I had asked for no bacon though and instead of swiss cheese can i have mozzarella. I had also order a milkshake to come out with my meal. The onion rings were good as an appetizer but then my burger came out. First they didn't add any guacamole so when i had told them it was missing they just gave me a side in a cup. Second i had to search the entire burger to see if there was even any cheese on it. There was barely any. While im eating my whole burger falls apart. The bread was just in pieces. I didn't really enjoy eating it with it being such a mess. They never brought out my milkshake until i had to remind them at the end. So i dont think this will be a place i will be returning whenever im craving a burger.

This is by far the worst meal I have had in my life. I have never been to a Red Robin before and I can assure you, I will never return. The service was slow and we had to ask for things numerous times before we received them (napkins, utensils, etc.). I was told at first they do not have booster seats, just high chairs. So we decided to sit in a booth anyway without having to put my 3 year old in a high chair. About 5 minutes later some guy, maybe the manager, came out from the closet with a booster that he claimed he found in the kitchen. Weird. I had the A1 burger and ordered it medium rare but it came out like a hockey puck. The garlic Parmesan fries were soggy and really had no flavor. My stomach hurt the entire night after this event. Will definitely not return!

OKay, so I can totally see why this place would have the Yelp rating it does. I have been wanting to try Red Robin for a while. The marketing geniuses with their ...Red Robin...Yummm....jingle is really effective. I have been going to Bergen Town Center forever and every time we leave I say that we should try it. Well we finally did. We went about 3 PM on a Saturday afternoon and the place was more or less empty. We were greeted after a minute or so (no one was at the hostess table at the time) and taken to a table. So....the1-2 star portion of my review is for the condition. The floors were sticky the entire walk to the table. The table was sticky and hadn't been wiped ?for the day?, longer? Any place that I hate put my forearms on the table due to stickiness, is a no-no. The server was nice, helpful and patient with us. Kudos to her. They do have mobile stations where you can order food and play games/apps ($1.99 for unlimited app play). Be careful not to let the little ones play with the device, they can order games and apps to their hearts desire and you will get billed. Once you hit a game/app there is one confirmation screen in case you made a mistake, and if you hit yes again, you'll be billed. We left it alone and chose the human server instead. There were larger flat screen TVs around showing the Olympic games which was nice. Now, the 2-3 star portion of my review, the food. Food didn't take long to come. I ordered a massive burger because it looked good and I am glad to say that it was good. The toppings were fresh and adequate. I have to say that it was really satisfying, coming from a chain restaurant. We also had the pizza (blah), shrimp (blah), chicken tenders (semi-blah) and mac and cheese (double-blah). In their defense they do advertise and are probably known best for their burgers, and they should be. If you go, order burgers.... that's about it. Anything else will likely leave you disappointed. Though chicken tenders, fries, nachos, onion rings and other items that most likely come frozen to be thrown into a deep fryer are probably safer bets. I regret my $50 experience but I can say that I tried it. Lesson learned. A plus was that you can pay at the table using the device. No more waiting for the "check" which is honestly to me the most dreadful part of eating out. Swipe your card, and a couple of clicks later, you're gone. It even calculates and recommends the different tips that you can choose from, which I know for some is a pain as well. More restaurants should have that option.

This place is a disaster. We came in for my mothers birthday. We ordered a skinny margarita and a mojito. The mojito tasted like dirty dish water. Finally after 15 minutes I got a different drink. Then we got the on in rings which were delicious. Then I got this burger with Mac and cheese in between the parties, well not only did it not come like that but it was sloppily made. My mothers burger was wrong too. They had them remade and came out looking worse. My burger was somehow precut already in the opposite direction I cut it. I've got indigestion now and I can't wait to get out of here. Oh and I'm still waiting for my straw for my drink! 1 1/2 hours for two burgers here is ridiculous! Management barely apologized.

I have only had take out from here but the burgers are solid and my order was ready in less than 10 min.  The Bottomless sides option is a nice perk if you are eating in, and includes the coleslaw, broccoli, and side salad as alternatives to the fries.  Prices are on par with your Fast Casual tier places like Applebee's and Chili's.  I wouldn't call the burgers here "gourmet" but they are decent.  The servers are very friendly and helpful, which is a plus.

This was my first and last Red Robin experience. We stood in the waiting area for about 6 minutes before anyone acknowledged us, I guess that should been the first clue since the place wasn't busy at all. No smiles, barely greeted. Then they got my order wrong, Mac and Cheese burger without the Mac and Cheese, and it didn't look at all as advertised when it was corrected. I probably could have gotten a better burger at McDonalds, the kids were happy though.

I'm not even sure why I still even come here... The bartender tonight is so rude and it's not even busy.  I hear other tables complaining about him too.  The fries are always cold.  I've been done eating for 15 minutes the bartender has not asked me anything dessert check ect???

Dirty. Second time to this location. This time was worse than first. Everything in this place was dirty. Menus: sticky. Tables sticky and dirty, to the point where our son asked to our chairs and tables wiped down from our own wet naps. Digital kiosk: sticky, so much so can't even swipe right. Forks and knives placed on table for us: one or two forks were not clean properly and still had leftover food on it. Come on: basics, just wipe down the place. Place was empty, and went at 11am which is like time of opening. No other guests sat or were in booths.  When everything is dirty like this, you cannot enjoy your meal. Going to shake shack up the block next time

The food is sub-par, but my experience with the service was first class all the way. My server was a gentleman named Koray and Red Robin executives need to give this man a gold star.  My family and I came to this location tonight, despite the 2-star overall Yelp rating, my nephews were craving pizza and this was the closest option. The food is not great. So many other things went wrong. The clam chowder and mac and cheese were "watery." The restaurant was also sold out of the whole wheat hamburger buns. But, I really didn't care because Koray was a great server and provided amazing service. He was very prompt and attentive continuously asking us if we needed any refills on our bottomless sides and drinks. He was knowledgeable about the Red Robin menu and went to great lengths to explain what a Red Robin Tavern was. He apologized profusely when they ran out of the whole wheat hamburger bun and offered a plethora of other bun options. He even informed us how we could get half-off for our kid's dinner. He was so generous with his time and hospitality, we decided to still pay full price for the kid's meals. The guy was a great salesman and told us to come back on other nights when they would have "specials." I would gladly return because of our experience with Koray. He made our Sunday family dinner a great one. Thanks Koray- keep up the great work!

I want to update this post. Red Robin asked me to send my contact information to them which I did about an hour after they requested it. I still have not heard anything from them. Very disturbing  I would like to warn anyone who goes to this restaurant that your safety and your personal belongings are at risk. My wife's cell phone was stolen off the table. The manager refused to look at the security cameras to see who did it. The phone remained inside the building for almost 4 hours proving it was an employee of red robin. The manager Ahmad Told the police and myself that there were 4 iPads stolen from the restaurant by the employees and this was confirmed by Paramus PD police reports. No action by mgr confirms the problems there. Wanted to send a $30 gift card for our trouble

Horrible. Went there today with hubs for the first time . Should have gone to bobbys burger place but he wanted to try it out. Not worth the money and they don't use fresh ingredients. Save yourself money and time and go to Bobbys Burger Place right in the Bergen Towne Center. Avoid at all costs.

They got my burger ready in about 15-20 minutes. I ordered Burnin Love. If you love spicy food, then you'll enjoy this one!! I eat only halal meat so, i requested to replace the beef patty with a veggie patty. The veggie patty was nothing special but a nice substitute. I am sure if i were to eat it with beef patty, it would have had enhanced the flavor. Overall i enjoyed the burger

I wish I could comment on the food, but quite frankly, we were never served. It was a Friday night and a small group from work decided to go to Red Robin. The second we walked in we were greeted by careless workers and the empty promise that our waiter would be here shortly. It was fairly empty in the restaurant and the lighting was uncomfortably bright. We sat at our table for nearly 30 minutes and no one served us. Now I would understand it if was packed but it wasn't. Workers walked by us and just ignored us. It didn't feel good being ignored. And we were also starving. After 30 minutes of nothing, we decided to leave. Only go here if you don't plan on eating.

3.5 stars rounded up but be warned: service is very (very) hit or miss. Otherwise it's one of the better RR locations I've checked out. So far, every time Red Robin releases a new experimental burger, this place always has it on time (like the chicken & waffle sandwich). It isn't always made the way it's described but everything still tastes good. I've never had to wait for a table longer than 5 minutes. Most of the times there are plenty of seats, actually. And at the tables they've implemented Ziosk, the tablet to order, checkout, play games, and call server (which doesn't seem to do anything besides flash a light). Make sure you take advantage of the bottomless fries!

I've been to this Red Robin twice before my last visit.  I've always tended to avoid it because I wasn't crazy about the service or the food but this last time was awesome.  Two palms up.  It's a 10. 1. Speed- The food came out quickly.  I was starving.  Thank you, Red Robin. 2. Service- The service was friendly and awesome. The waitress made me feel welcome and helped elevate my dining experience with her great attitude. 3. Burger- Usually, the food is too greasy but my Whiskey River BBQ burger was made just right and a Hail Mary burger in my desperate time of hunger.  I've ordered this burger before and it's usually so messy and greasy.  This time, it was on point and perfect.  I ate it with very, very minimal bbq mess to the hands. 4. Electronic thingy- Their electronic ordering thingy at the table (it looks like a tablet) actually worked properly.  A few times, I've had these things on my table as defunct table ornaments but this worked great and made paying and ordering extra things a very easy thing. 5. Dessert- Um, have you tried the mudpie?  It's like, the dream of my childhood.  It's like a gigantic slice of ice cream cake but made with oreos.  It's fantastic.  It's very sweet.  It's self indulgent to order it.  It's awesome. 6. Clean bathroom- Hooray for cleanliness! 7. Lowered sink in bathroom- There's a tiny sink in the bathroom for your tiny child to clean their tiny hands without you having to carry them up to the stink to do it.  How thoughtful of Red Robin to make that. 8. Location- Located on the not busy side of The Bergen Town Center, there's ample parking, which is a big plus during the holiday season. 9. Bottomless fries- Their fries were great and not greasy and also, you can refill your fries.  Who does that? 10.  Freckled lemonade- I had forgotten how much I loved this drink.  It's awesome.  It has sweetened strawberries pureed and sliced, put into the drink.  A lot of times, I don't like too sweet, but this is a sweet drink that I like.  Definitely, get this drink, as long as you aren't allergic to strawberries.  Or lemons. And bonuuuusss..... they have a bar!  I love bars and a good drink.  Does that make me sound alcoholic?  Actually, I don't think I've ever had a drink at this Red Robin but it's always nice to know that the option is there. I will definitely go back.  Hopefully, after I run a marathon because I gained about 10lbs after eating all the delicious food here.  Also, don't come in here judging this place with standards meant for Per Se.  It's Red Robin for crying out loud!  It's awesome for Red Robin and comparable restaurants.  The service though, that could've been high end.

Update: 12/28/2016 No improvement.  I love Red Robins, but this location is sub-par. They advertise unlimited fries, but never manage to get those refills to the table. They also have a bad system of having the bar tender also serve the tables closest to the bar. The tables always get neglected.

ALL YOU NEED TO KNOW: - Amazing and perfectly cooked burgers - Best fries (RR serves my all-time favorite fries) and Freckled Lemonade ever. AND THEY'RE BOTH BOTTOMLESS. - Great service (Our server from yesterday, Nelly, was especially awesome!) I also love that RR is one of the many restaurants that uses those electronic pads on each table that allow you to call your server, order more food/drinks, and pay for your check whenever you're ready.  ---------------------------------- MY ADVICE FOR MANAGEMENT (and the reason why I deducted a star): ***Please be mindful of your incoming crowd on busy Friday/weekend nights, and have enough hosts working to handle that crowd.*** Last night (Friday) around 8pm, I patiently waited at the host stand for over 5 minutes for someone to write my name down as I watched the hostess run all over the place. (I'm used to waiting for a table on busy nights, but not so much for someone to simply write my name down and tell me how long the wait is.) When she finally stopped running around, she just started taking names in the middle of the room instead of at the host stand. When I politely said "excuse me" to grab her attention, she put up her index finger at me as if to silence me then ignored me for a few seconds. Then she looked up, realized she never wrote my name down, then someone seated our table of 2 right away. I ALWAYS give a restaurant the benefit of the doubt and I even saw the manager running the food out to help, so I'm assuming someone called out or was late. But at the end of the day, the host is the person who sets your dining standard upon walking into a restaurant and there should always be someone up there to greet the guests and put them on a wait list if it's busy.
Great Service the food is amazing  I have. A good service from my waiter aiman   She is wonderful

Our 1st time going to Red Robin. We went around lunch time. Walking through the door we stood to an empty restaurant. I know they were open cause I saw people sitting and eating. What I didn't see were employees. So right about the time we started to sit ourselves, someone came out of the kitchen. He sat us and left. A server came up to the table and asked if we ever been there before we, Responded no. She took our drink order and shortly after we ordered my daughters food and nachos to share. Meatballs on a stick.  Moments later the server came back and we ordered our food. My wife ordered a ghost chili burger well done and I ordered a pepper something burger med rare.  So the nachos and my daughters food came out. The nachos were good. My daughters food on the other hand wasn't. The meatballs were rock hard and cold. Only thing she ate was 2 helping of broccoli and fries from our meal.several times I had to ask for a refill and napkins.  My wife's burger came out which she was happy about. My burger was over cooked. I asked the server if she could take it back. I explained that I ordered the burger med rare and it was cooked well done. She apologized and told it back. Meanwhile my wife only took a couple bits waiting for my food to arrive. Approx 5mins went by and it returned. Now I was expecting a raw burger. How cooked can a burger get after cooking for about 5mins..  well I cut it open and it was well done again!!! Questing the freshness of the burger. I believe they precook the food. This time I waved down a manager. She claimed to be in training. I asked if I could speak to someone that cold help if she couldn't. She told me to tell her what's I needed to. After explaining about our issues, she stated that we needed to talk to the manger. So a manger came out of the kitchen. She came to the table pretty much yelling at us. She stated that they don't cook the burgers under med what restaurant doesn't know how to cook. To continue getting a temp wrong. For a manager to come to the table to say this is crazy! When asking her name she refused to tell me when I asked for the general managers name she looked at me and walked away.  Since they had a thing on the table to pay we did it that way. They were taking forever to return to the table with the check. When I called the corp number the lady on the phone say in order to get any kind of gift card everyone from my group had to call and complain. This includes my 15mth daughter. She said this was Red Robin's policy..  wow really!!  This place is just better to drive by it and go somewhere else

I dont know how they named a burger place red robin but this place really does well when it comes to impressing people with great food. The place is at a great location and the seating is really comfortable with the view of the shoppers across the street. I have been there multiple times and all of the waitresses i have had were just truly amazing. They are very nice and prompt with everything, and your food it ready no longer than 10 mins so if you are looking for a quick grab then this is your place. Their fried onion rings, or the fries are just very flavorful and they make them very fresh. The burgers tho are probably the best part of this placex their whiskey river bbq chicken or the teryiaki chicken are really the home runners. The buns are are really good and you can chose from different varieties of buns even the ramen noodle bun which is basically ramen noodles made into a bun which is quite filling. Oh almost forgot about the amazing milkshake options, which come with 2 different size for a dollar difference and they taste extremely satisfying. Great place for weekend dinner or everyday dinner

Food was ok, waiter was inattentive despite the fact that the restaurant was practically empty. Nobody should have to wait 30 minutes before even being asked about drinks if the restaurant is empty. The other yelper is correct in saying that the "bottomless" fries never arrive. Not sure about the other locations, but this location wouldn't be missed if it closed.

Went shopping near by and decided to stop in with the family. One thug is have to say is the customer service was probably the most impressive thing. We greeted within a couple seconds of entering the place and seated and had our drink orders taken all within the first 30 seconds of being in the place.  We started with a teriyaki wings as a starter, and to drink a coke, lemonade and a baileys shake. Accept for the shake the drinks were there within a minute and the shake came about 3-4 min later with the starter maybe a couple of minutes after that. At this point we had already placed our order with Deanna (our server) with DBear fixing and bringing our drinks which is a good system since it allowed for less wait time and quick service.  I had a salmon entree and burger with broccoli and fries which was very good. No complaints and ended up leaving a seemingly clean plate. Fries weren't drenched I salt like most places have a habit of doing. The salmon was well cooked and tasted great and the broccoli was at the perfect texture. My baileys drink was amazing and I even got the opportunity to try their cookies and cream shake via there rewards program. I've been to other locations many times and I have never even had someone even mention that they had a program similar to Fridays strips program. Opted not to have desert but just because all of us were already satisfied. All in all great experience food and service and the general atmosphere was great. Place was clean not too loud and staff was extremely friendly.

Probably the worst burger joint I've been to. Lack of service , over priced food and over all the ticket time is super slow. You would think this place would be packed , it wasn't . The food is ok nothing great .

I was contacted by RR and they requested my email to "discuss" my revive. After several days I received an email thanking me for my comments. They wrote they would discuss the issues with the management of this RR and work to make my next visit better.  Didn't seem to matter I wasted good money on food I had to toss in trash.  Just a sort of canned response to show how much they care. Well I hope my money helped with your profit margin but to me I have to question what else are they doing wrong in the kitchen if something this simple.  Sorry this place has become a no go for me. Other better places around.

We visited this location for lunch during a rainy day, more like a torrential downpour. Upon exiting our car and approaching the entrance, I noticed an employee in their bright red shirt leaning against the building wall having a cigarette. My first impression was not a favorable one. I don't care if a person smokes, but employees shouldn't be hanging out in front of the building looking like they have nothing better to do. We received a nice greeting from the manager and another employee. The place was empty for lunch, probably due to the weather. We were seated and then greeted by the gentleman who was smoking out front, and smelled like smoke. Not a pleasant smell. We ordered "gourmet" burgers, onion rings and sweet potato fries. The meal came quickly. That alarms me, but the place was empty. I ordered the A.1. Peppercorn burger. It was good, just good. Worthy of a "gourmet" title? No. It wasn't worthy of the $11.89 price, either. For that price, the sweet potato fries shouldn't have cost me an additional $1.49. I thought $2.99 for my friend's soda was pretty steep. I don't drink soda, so I don't know if it is. I drink water. My friend liked her BBQ burger. Her onion rings were good. This was my first visit to a Red Robin. No compelling reason to come back when Habit Burger is closer to home, better and cheaper. There is a little kiosk on every table that allows you to pay your bill, play games and watch their advertising. The trivia game was on while we dined. We jumped in the game while we waited for the rain to let up. An additional $1.99 appeared on my bill for "Entertainment". It turns out that you have to pay to play. It doesn't tell you before you jump in the game. We were told by the manager that it is mentioned on the first splash screen that appears after you are seated. We didn't see it. All we saw was a game in progress, so we played. The charge was removed from my bill. The kiosk is convenient for paying your bill, as you don't have to wait around for your server to bring it to you. The receipt is printed for you, too. Overall, the experience was just okay, nothing special. Gourmet? No. Just a fancy marketing title. The better option is a cheaper Tavern burger for $6.99.

What horrible service. We waited for ever for everything...even a beer took 10 minutes (not exaggerating). Our waitress kept trying to push additions on us I felt like I was in a bad infomercial. The food was normal chain red Robin, still not a fan of steak fries.

Came today for lunch. We were greeted by the hostess and seated immediately. Our waiter, Ross, was awesome! He helped us navigate the menu and gave us some guidance when choosing between two burgers. Ordered their passion fruit margarita and my boyfriend had their spiked freckled lemonade - both were delicious. For anyone that loves spicy food, I recommend you order the Burnin' Love and pair it with their ghost pepper sauce. I've been here a couple times and have never left disappointed. Great burgers and great fries!

I will admit that I am usually disappointed whenever I come here.  I don't like any sauces so no matter what burger I order, I ask for it without the sauce and guess what?  It NEVER comes that way.  So, either I send it back and have to wait while everyone else is eating or i try to wipe off the offending condiment and eat while complaining the whole time.  Did I mention that I am a joy to dine with? No? Hahaha I chose to order salsa chicken and not a burger.  Salsa is the only condiment I eat.  Chicken came as expected and the side salad I ordered without dressing actually came without dressing! The food itself was okay.  The chicken was a little dry.  The salsa had an odd taste.  I think it had too much lime in it.   Red Robin will never be a place I actively seek out to dine,  but if the group wants to go I will go.  I guess I will just have to stick to non burger food.

We haven't been to this location for over a year and decided to give it another try. Last visit was good. The food was really good and the service by our server Ashley was excellent. The manager even came by and introduced himself and asked if we needed anything. He even shook our hands when we left and thanked us. That goes a very long way with me.
For all of your burger lovers. I will recommend this place , Burger is really good however fries I didn't like it. I also order a banana milkshake that was OK

Excellent food they have the best Burger it's fresh yummy and cooked in a perfect way, the Purple drink so tasty, Thank you so much Amy for the best service you are so nice and professional.  Will be back again to try more items.

Since I had the day off from work, I decided to take my kids out to lunch so I decided in Red Robin. The hostess was nice and sat us down. We waited about 10 minutes for the waitress to come by our table and asked if we were ready. We gave her the drink order while we decided on what we wanted. The waitress came by 10 minutes later and we ordered the food. My kids and I felt like the waitress was not helpful, cordial or even human.... she acted more like a robot (no feelings or reactions). The food was ok but I remember when the food was great. The over all experience was very poor and did not leave me with a great taste in my mouth. No yummm for this Red Robin

Most people are friendly and pleasant. But was greeting by a very sure young lady at the front that clearly lacked  costumer service skills. It's all about the attitude, costumers should not know that you are having a bad day or just don't love what you do. Especially when children witnessed it.

I enjoy Red Robin but not the establishment and not the service. It is really hit or miss, and when it's a miss it is just absolutely sh*tty.  Just god awful. Deanna was our server and she seemed courteous in the beginning then things quickly went sour when she started making stank faces at us and at some point thrust the menu in my husbands face when he asked to see it again, and it was baffling how nasty she was. She literally threw the automated table side computer thing in front of him when he told her he wanted to put his royalty number into the order. Wow! Then she goes to the next table and turned on this dr jekyl and Hyde multiple personality thing and was gushing smiling at them and asked them how their meal was and she did not ask us once how our meal was or asked if we need a drink refill.   This is why when I have a craving for Red Robin, my better judgment kicks in and stops me. The service is horrific and inconsistent. Deanna just proved to me that there is no hope for Red Robin as a service establishment. Is management in this company so horrendous that all their workers are persistently unhappy and nasty to their customers? I believe their store manager name is Adolfo, and I only know this because I heard a complaining customer at another table inquiring for his name.  Our service tonight was so atrocious that i will be calling him out for the poor attitude of his store staff, specifically Deanna.

I co-manage a restaurant in San Diego, California and every time I visit my mother who lives here we visit this Red Robin for lunch. Our server-bartender, Kate, was amazing today. Not everyone understands what it's like to work the bar AND have tables on top of your bar seats. She had our drinks filled, ran food and had it out to us in a timely manor, had 7-8 tables, made everyone's drinks, and kept it lively. Thank you!!!

The beef, chicken and fish dishes are good. Bottomless fries and salad is a cool gimmick. But ... I ordered a vodka ... double - which was less in quantity than singles in most decent places in New Jersey.  Place is nice looking , good attentive staff. So if you come for a Friday's/Applebee's type experience - do come here ... pleasant place

I have been here many times and even though there have been a few times that the food was not the best it was ok. However, this Friday was probably the last time I go. My wife ordered the Chicken Ensenada and when it came out the chicken was over cooked and the salad was rancid. We told our server and she explained to the manager. All he did was take the food off the bill. He never came out to apologize and ask if there is anything else they can get you. Even the waitress did not ask. They finally offered a free dessert. I paid the bill and we left without me even eating my food. When a manager cannot make the effort to come out and make sure the customer is satisfied with the service and find out what happened that is just absolutely poor customer service and shows you do not care about your customers.

Stopped by for take out - service was excellent - my order was perfect! I was very surprised because each of the burgers that I ordered had the build your own burger toppings and sauce on the side and they were all done perfectly. Turkey burgers were seasoned just right and the onion rings and fries were crispy and delicious!

We never had our drinks or fries refilled. The bartender was our server on a day with with less than 3 customers at his section. He purposely ignored us when we flagged him down for requests. We left the restaurant dehydrated from the salty food.

10 years ago this place was one of my preferred places to go, but what awake up call! Aside from the strawberry freckled lemonade everything was pretty awful. I couldn't believe I had stopped watching Stranger Things season 2 episode 7 to go here (should have ordered in). The nachos were horrible and I had to send them back because of the cold chili. After that everything was an entire disaster. I wish I was Toothless so I could not even attempt to eat this. I didn't complete the meal nor did my wife as it was overly greasy. Jingle, "Red Robin...Nope."

I went here yesterday at my daughter's request. We quickly regretted it. She was hungry and beginning to have a headache so we figured this would be pretty quick and easy. We were wrong. I will say that the host and waiter were friendly. But we had to wait so long for everything. The place was pretty empty and yet it took an extremely long time for our order to be put in and then to get our order. After admitting to forget to put our order in the waiter cane back to tell us they didn't even have what my daughter ordered. I felt so bad as her headache just kept getting worse during all this wait.  I just don't understand all the waiting and issues on such a slow night. Their solution was to bring fries while we waited and then a free dessert that my daughter kept saying she didn't even want.

Me and my sister decided to grab lunch here. When we walked in there was a lot of people near the entrance waiting to be seated and a hostess no where to be found. We stood there for a good 10 minutes until one of the waitresses came by and took names down and seated everyone. Once we got seated, we  put in our drink, appetizer & entree orders at once because we both knee what we wanted. We didn't get our drinks for another 20 minutes. When we got our appetizer, the soggy pretzel bites, our burgers came out like a minute after so we had all the food out together. My sister got the new sriracha tavern doue burger and I ordered the taco tavern double. My burger was missing pretty much all the ingredients that made it a taco tavern burger... I told my server and she said that's the right order but quickly got me a new burger. It didn't really taste as expected. Probably won't be coming back here too soon

God awful. If horse manure was a restaurant this is what it would be. I'm sorry to the managers and owners because they are really nice but don't come here. I've been coming here since it opened and it has gone down hill as drastically. At first it was a good place for a burger and would often drive decent crowds. Since then, they've started to slack off in food quality. For example on my most recent visit, the cake I had was as hard as a rock. Now nobody comes here and there are more employees there than customers. It's honestly creepy. I've also seen fights break out here and the workers saying that that is pretty normal and we shouldn't worry about it. Overall this restaurant is awful.

Not sure why this location received such critical reviews. My visit here was nothing short of amazing. The waitress was very pleasant and available when we needed her. The food was excellent. I tried the quinoa veggie burger - delicious. The mudd pie was delicious. A large portion, enough for 2 to 3 people.
This place was just alright my burger didn't have too much flavor and the fries was flavorless. The angry orchard that i had was good though. My server held it down.

I've waited almost 2 years to return here for a meal! Party of 8, two families.  We were seated and ordered.. I pleaded for a burger with some pink and not well done.  I asked nicely three times before our waitress left.  The burger came completely brown and well done.. the waitress never came back to even get a chance to ask for a new one.  My husband got up and brought the burger back.  Three people had empty glasses the majority of their meal bc the waitress just never came back.  The manager delivered my burger and apologized. We told him we needed drinks and wanted to order dessert.  5 mins later drinks still didn't come.  We stopped the waitress when she was walking by to ask for drinks again lol I felt like we were bothering her.  We are two nice families with kids, we didn't ask for anything other than drink refills which seemed like such a huge ask.  Our desserts were free which was appreciated for the lengthy visit and mishaps but it's just mind-boggling that this location cannot seem to get its act together.
